analyzed: bud med de lus dang bral nas yi dvags bshang ba za ba rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de'i las kyi mthus de'i tshe'ang snga ma bzhin la de'i lus bkres pa dang / skom pas gdungs te /

original: gal te de rnyed na'ang @471a *//
analyzed: gal te de rnyed na'ang @471a *//
translated: If she finds feces,

translated: it will always be small and

original: lto tshim par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lto tshim par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: she will not be satisfied.

translated: If she finds feces among the hungry ghosts, it will be infested with worms, eaten, and full of holes.

analyzed: rgyang ring zhing tshegs chen pos rnyed pa de'ang chog par mi rnyed do //

analyzed: de ltar de'i tshe'i mtha' sdug bsngal ba 'thob ste /

analyzed: de ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las yi dvags kyi 'jig rten 'grub pa ser sna byas pa bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du bkres pa dang / skom pa de byas pa'i sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur / de phyis yi dvags kyi 'jig rten bshang ba za ba de las thar bar 'gyur te /
translated: For as long as the karmic actions of beings in the world of starving spirits are not exhausted, they will continue to experience the suffering of hunger and thirst.

translated: “When they finally escape the world of starving spirits, they will, in accordance with their causal actions, continue to wander in cyclic existence.

original: de dbul zhing nad bu can la bza' ba nyung ba dang / srog gi 'tsho ba rtag tu gzhan la rag las shing tshegs chen pos 'tsho ba 'thob la de na du ma med pa'i snod du 'gyur /
analyzed: de dbul zhing nad bu can la bza' ba nyung ba dang / srog gi 'tsho ba rtag tu gzhan la rag las shing tshegs chen pos 'tsho ba 'thob la de na du ma med pa'i snod du 'gyur /
translated: If, with the likelihood of a sea turtle poking its head through a yoke floating on the ocean, they should be born with the general lot in life of a human, they will be poor and sickly, with little to eat. Their lives will be dependent on others, and they will have to struggle to obtain their livelihood. They will be vessels for misfortune.

original: sems shes pa dang / mi shes pa phal pa yin zhing lus rma mtshan dang dri ma can mi sdug pa skye bo kun gyis smad par 'gyur /
analyzed: sems shes pa dang / mi shes pa phal pa yin zhing lus rma mtshan dang dri ma can mi sdug pa skye bo kun gyis smad par 'gyur /
translated: They are ordinary beings who are ignorant of the mind and have bodies that are marked by wounds and impurities, and are ugly and despised by everyone.

original: de'i kha nas kyang dri mnam po 'byung zhing glo bur du so nag por 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: de'i kha nas kyang dri mnam po 'byung zhing glo bur du so nag por 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
translated: Their mouths emit a foul stench and their teeth suddenly turn black.

original: de nas yang dge slong las @471b kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des ser sna'i gnas su gyur pa'i yi dvags kyi 'jig rten la brtags na /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las @471b kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des ser sna'i gnas su gyur pa'i yi dvags kyi 'jig rten la brtags na /
translated: “Next, the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will examine the world of starving spirits that is a domain of stinginess.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas ser sna thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa yi dvags kha zas med pa zhes bya ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas ser sna thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa yi dvags kha zas med pa zhes bya ba mthong ngo //
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will then see the starving spirits known as those without food, who are a domain of all forms of stinginess.

original: der las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: der las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: Wondering what karmic actions may cause one to be born in that way, he will examine this with knowledge derived from hearing.

original: skyes pa'am / bud med ser snas zil gyis non cing phrag dog gi zil gyis non pa dang / g-yo thabs sam /
analyzed: skyes pa'am / bud med ser snas zil gyis non cing phrag dog gi zil gyis non pa dang / g-yo thabs sam /
translated: He will then notice how stingy men or women, overcome by stinginess and jealousy, may deceive their friends and relatives with trickery and deceit.

original: slu bar byed pa stobs dang ldan pa gang gis sems can dag bcing bas bcings te /
analyzed: slu bar byed pa stobs dang ldan pa gang gis sems can dag bcing bas bcings te /
translated: The powerful deceiver binds beings with fetters,

original: kha zas ma byin pas srog dang phral la /
analyzed: kha zas ma byin pas srog dang phral la /

original: srog dang phral nas kyang snying nas 'chags par mi byed la 'gyod par mi byed /
analyzed: srog dang phral nas kyang snying nas 'chags par mi byed la 'gyod par mi byed /
translated: Having deprived them of life, he does not confess his crime from the heart, nor does he feel remorse.

original: yang las de nyid byas nas rjes su dga' bar byed cing gzhan dag kyang de nyid la rab tu 'jog par byed /
analyzed: yang las de nyid byas nas rjes su dga' bar byed cing gzhan dag kyang de nyid la rab tu 'jog par byed /
translated: Having committed that action, he delights in it and establishes others in it.

original: las dang / las kyi nyer bsdogs dang / las kyi mjug dag byas nas yang de nyid byed na /
analyzed: las dang / las kyi nyer bsdogs dang / las kyi mjug dag byas nas yang de nyid byed na /
translated: Having committed the action, the preparation for the action, and the conclusion of the action, he does it again and again.

original: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba yi dvags kha zas med pa rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba yi dvags kha zas med pa rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When he later separates from his body, he falls into the lower realms and is born among the hungry ghosts who have no food.

original: skyes pa'am / bud med de der skyes nas /
analyzed: skyes pa'am / bud med de der skyes nas /
translated: When he is born there,

original: kha zas med par byas nas bkres pa dang / skom par byas pa me des sreg pa na yang dang yang du ri las chu 'bab pa'i shugs ltar bkras pa dang / skom pa'i sdug bsngal mang du 'phel lo //
analyzed: kha zas med par byas nas bkres pa dang / skom par byas pa me des sreg pa na yang dang yang du ri las chu 'bab pa'i shugs ltar bkras pa dang / skom pa'i sdug bsngal mang du 'phel lo //
translated: The fire burns them, causing hunger and thirst, and the suffering of hunger and thirst increases greatly, like the force of a waterfall from a mountain.

original: de'i kha zas med par byas pa'i mthu des ji ltar thal ba'ang mi mngon pa de ltar @472a *//
analyzed: de'i kha zas med par byas pa'i mthu des ji ltar thal ba'ang mi mngon pa de ltar @472a *//
translated: The power of their lack of food causes their bodies to become so emaciated that even their ashes are not visible.

original: de'i nang dang / yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad sreg go /
analyzed: de'i nang dang / yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad sreg go /

original: de nas yang yan lag dang / nying lag de dag slar 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas yang yan lag dang / nying lag de dag slar 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Then, their limbs and fingers grow back again,

original: yang sreg par byed do //
analyzed: yang sreg par byed do //
translated: and the fire burns them again.

original: de bkres pa dang / skom pas gdungs pa dang / lus bsregs pa ste /
analyzed: de bkres pa dang / skom pas gdungs pa dang / lus bsregs pa ste /
translated: Thus, they are burned by the suffering of hunger and thirst and the burning of their bodies.

original: sdug bsngal gnyis kyis sreg pa na rang gi las kyi 'bras bu nyes par byas pas bslus pa de sdug bsngal gyis nyam thag nas shin tu ngu skad 'byin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gnyis kyis sreg pa na rang gi las kyi 'bras bu nyes par byas pas bslus pa de sdug bsngal gyis nyam thag nas shin tu ngu skad 'byin /
translated: Tormented by suffering, deceived by the results of their misdeeds, they cry out in agony.

original: cho nges 'debs /
analyzed: cho nges 'debs /
translated: They wail and lament.

original: smre sngags 'don cing phyogs dang / phyogs mtshams su rgyug ste /
analyzed: smre sngags 'don cing phyogs dang / phyogs mtshams su rgyug ste /
translated: Crying out, he runs in all directions and in between them.

original: de ni de'i nang du 'byung ba'i sdug bsngal yin no //
analyzed: de ni de'i nang du 'byung ba'i sdug bsngal yin no //
translated: This is the suffering of being born inside.

original: phyi rol tu 'byung ba'ang las kyis byas pa'i mes yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad sreg par byed do //
analyzed: phyi rol tu 'byung ba'ang las kyis byas pa'i mes yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad sreg par byed do //
translated: As for the suffering of being born outside, the fire created by his karma burns all his major and minor body parts.

original: me nang du song bslar byung nas phyi rol gyi lus kyang sreg par byed de /
analyzed: me nang du song bslar byung nas phyi rol gyi lus kyang sreg par byed de /
translated: When the fire has gone inside, it comes out again and burns his outer body.🔽Just as when fire enters a hollow tree, it burns the inside of the tree and then the outside, in the same way, the fire burns the hungry ghost from the inside and then the outside.

original: dper na / shing khong stong gi nang du me zhugs pa shing gi nang bsregs nas phyi rol sreg pa de bzhin du me des yi dvags de'i nang du bsregs nas phyi rol yang sreg par byed do; ;de nang dang / phyi rol thams cad tshal shing bsregs pa lta bur rab tu bsregs te me lce gcig tu gyur pas ngu skad 'byin cing cho nges 'debs so //
analyzed: dper na / shing khong stong gi nang du me zhugs pa shing gi nang bsregs nas phyi rol sreg pa de bzhin du me des yi dvags de'i nang du bsregs nas phyi rol yang sreg par byed do; ;de nang dang / phyi rol thams cad tshal shing bsregs pa lta bur rab tu bsregs te me lce gcig tu gyur pas ngu skad 'byin cing cho nges 'debs so //
translated: Everything inside and outside is completely burned, like a burned-out tree stump. The fire becomes a single flame and he cries out and wails.

original: de des cho nges 'debs pa na khar me 'byung ste /
analyzed: de des cho nges 'debs pa na khar me 'byung ste /

original: de yang dang / yang du de'i lus thams cad 'bar ba nyis 'gyur gyis ches rab tu 'bar bar byed do //
analyzed: de yang dang / yang du de'i lus thams cad 'bar ba nyis 'gyur gyis ches rab tu 'bar bar byed do //

original: gang dang / gang du 'gro ba'i lam de dang / der rtsva dar bha rab tu 'bar ba khab @472b lta bu 'byung bar 'gyur la gang de'i rkang pa gnyis bor ba ma rung bar byed de /🔽rkang pa ma rung ba de ngu skad 'byin /
analyzed: gang dang / gang du 'gro ba'i lam de dang / der rtsva dar bha rab tu 'bar ba khab @472b lta bu 'byung bar 'gyur la gang de'i rkang pa gnyis bor ba ma rung bar byed de / rkang pa ma rung ba de ngu skad 'byin /
translated: Wherever he goes, the path is covered with burning darbha grass, like needles, that destroy his feet.

original: cho nges 'debs /
analyzed: cho nges 'debs /
translated: With his feet destroyed, he cries out,🔽wails,

original: yongs su smre sngags 'don to //
analyzed: yongs su smre sngags 'don to //
translated: and laments.

original: de yongs su smre sngags 'don pa na de'i lce mar sar gyi gong bu ltar zhu bar byed de /
analyzed: de yongs su smre sngags 'don pa na de'i lce mar sar gyi gong bu ltar zhu bar byed de /

original: de nas yang nyes par byas pa'i las des slar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas yang nyes par byas pa'i las des slar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, due to that misdeed, he rises up again.

original: de gang dang / gang du rgyug pa de dang / der de'i nyes par byas pa'i las des chu dang / lteng ka dang / 'bab chu'i dngo dang / mtsho dang / chu 'dzag pa dang / chu bo dang / khron pa thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de gang dang / gang du rgyug pa de dang / der de'i nyes par byas pa'i las des chu dang / lteng ka dang / 'bab chu'i dngo dang / mtsho dang / chu 'dzag pa dang / chu bo dang / khron pa thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur /
translated: Wherever they run, they are deprived by their own bad actions of all water, ponds, streams, lakes, waterfalls, rivers, and wells.

original: tshal dang / nags tshal dang / khyim dang / ne'u gsing gi sa gzhi dang bral bar 'gyur /
analyzed: tshal dang / nags tshal dang / khyim dang / ne'u gsing gi sa gzhi dang bral bar 'gyur /
translated: They are deprived of the ground of forests, groves, houses, and parks.

original: tshal dang / nags tshal dag kyang log par mthong ste /
analyzed: tshal dang / nags tshal dag kyang log par mthong ste /
translated: They see the forests and groves as burning.

original: ri dang / ljon shing dang / ri sul gyi sa phyogs thams cad kyang rab tu 'bar bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: ri dang / ljon shing dang / ri sul gyi sa phyogs thams cad kyang rab tu 'bar bar mthong ngo //
translated: They see all the mountains, trees, and valleys as burning.

original: kun nas yi dvags kyi chang pa lag na ral gri dang / gtun shing khyer ba rnams kyis gtse bar byed cing spyo bar byed pas mchog tu sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: kun nas yi dvags kyi chang pa lag na ral gri dang / gtun shing khyer ba rnams kyis gtse bar byed cing spyo bar byed pas mchog tu sdug bsngal te /
translated: They are tormented and reviled by the ghosts of the dead, who carry swords and clubs in their hands.

analyzed: rang gi phrag dog dang / ser snas bslus shing sems kyi dgra dang lhan cig ldan pas tshe'ang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The lifespan is the same as before, but one is deceived by one’s own envy and stinginess, and one is accompanied by the enemies of the mind.

original: de ltar de nyes pa byas pa'i las byas pas ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las byas shing bsags pa bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du yi dvags kha zas med pa'i sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar de nyes pa byas pa'i las byas pas ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las byas shing bsags pa bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du yi dvags kha zas med pa'i sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur /
translated: “In this way, one will continue to experience the suffering of starvation among the starving spirits for as long as one’s completed and accumulated negative acts have not been overcome, relinquished, and exhausted.

original: de phyis yi dvags kyi yul de las thar bar 'gyur te /🔽thar nas kyang las de dang rgyu mthun par rang gis @473a *//
analyzed: de phyis yi dvags kyi yul de las thar bar 'gyur te / thar nas kyang las de dang rgyu mthun par rang gis @473a *//
translated: When one finally escapes that realm of starving spirits,🔽one will, in accordance with one’s causal actions, experience the effects of the actions one has committed.

original: las byas pa'i las spyad pa ji ltar las nye bar 'gro bas 'khor bar yongs su 'khyam mo //
analyzed: las byas pa'i las spyad pa ji ltar las nye bar 'gro bas 'khor bar yongs su 'khyam mo //
translated: One will thus continue to roam through cyclic existence in accordance with one’s karmic actions.

original: de gal te mi rnams kyi nang du gnya' shing gi bu gar rus sbal 'jug pa lta bur mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mir skyes na /
analyzed: de gal te mi rnams kyi nang du gnya' shing gi bu gar rus sbal 'jug pa lta bur mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mir skyes na /
translated: “If, with the likelihood of a sea turtle poking its head through a yoke floating on the ocean, one should be born with the general lot in life of a human,

original: de mngal na gnas pa na ma de zas 'dod pa med par 'gyur /
analyzed: de mngal na gnas pa na ma de zas 'dod pa med par 'gyur /
translated: one’s mother will have no appetite while one is in her womb.

original: gang gis ma de'i lus dang / bzhin kha dog mchog tu mi sdug par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis ma de'i lus dang / bzhin kha dog mchog tu mi sdug par 'gyur /
translated: The mother’s body and face will become extremely ugly.

original: de gal te mngal de nyid du gnas pa na las rab tu mthu che ba dang / srog bcad pa rab tu mthu che ba des 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: de gal te mngal de nyid du gnas pa na las rab tu mthu che ba dang / srog bcad pa rab tu mthu che ba des 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur /
translated: If the being in the womb dies, the mother’s karma will be very powerful and her life will be in great danger.

analyzed: gal te yang brgya la btsa' bar gyur na de ltar ngan pa byas pa 'dus byas de'i ma rtag tu dri nga zhing mdog mi sdug la mdangs med par 'gyur /
translated: If the mother gives birth, the one who has committed such evil deeds will be born in a place that is always foul-smelling, ugly, and without luster.

original: de srog gi 'tsho ba dus thung zhing tshegs chen pos thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: de srog gi 'tsho ba dus thung zhing tshegs chen pos thob par 'gyur /
translated: The life of such a being will be short and difficult.

analyzed: yul gyi bdag po rgya pos kyang de ltar btson rar bcug nas bkres pa dang / skom pa dag gis 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
translated: The king of the land will imprison such a person, and he will die of hunger and thirst.”

original: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des yi dvags kyi 'jig rten la brtags na /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des yi dvags kyi 'jig rten la brtags na /
translated: “The monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects then examined the world of starving spirits.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas yi dvags dri za ba zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas yi dvags dri za ba zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
translated: Through hearing and seeing, he will understand that there are hungry ghosts known as “stench-eaters.”

analyzed: der las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: Inquiring into what type of karmic action may cause one to be born in that way, he will apply insight derived from hearing and thus perceive the following:

analyzed: gang gis bza' ba dang / btung ba mang po shin tu bsdus nas bdag 'ba' zhig za la /

original: bu dang @473b chung ma dag la yang dag par 'ged par mi byed /
analyzed: bu dang @473b chung ma dag la yang dag par 'ged par mi byed /

analyzed: de dag ro bro ba 'dod na dri tsam zhig la snom du 'jug /
translated: When they wish to enjoy the taste of the food, they will let their children and spouse smell it.

analyzed: de bu dang / chung ma de'i mdun du rang 'ba' zhig za bar byed la /
translated: In front of their children and spouse, they will then eat the food themselves.

original: phrag dog dang / ser snas zin pas yang dag par 'ged par mi byed de /
analyzed: phrag dog dang / ser snas zin pas yang dag par 'ged par mi byed de /
translated: Because they are seized by jealousy and stinginess, they will not share it.

original: de ltar bu dang / chung ma ris mthun pa lhan cig 'khod pa la brnyas par byed cing gzhan dag kyang de nyid la rab tu 'jog par byed pa la rjes su dga' zhing /
analyzed: de ltar bu dang / chung ma ris mthun pa lhan cig 'khod pa la brnyas par byed cing gzhan dag kyang de nyid la rab tu 'jog par byed pa la rjes su dga' zhing /
translated: They will treat their children and spouse with contempt, and they will also encourage others to do the same.

original: de nas yang bdag gcig pu za bar byed la de byas nas kyang skyon du mi 'gyur zhing ngo tsha bar mi byed na /
analyzed: de nas yang bdag gcig pu za bar byed la de byas nas kyang skyon du mi 'gyur zhing ngo tsha bar mi byed na /
translated: Then, if he eats alone and does not consider that to be a fault or feel ashamed of it,

analyzed: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba yi dvags dri za ba rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro // der skyes nas lus rtag tu bkres pa dang / skom pas gdungs shing gar bab tu rgyug ste ngu skad 'byin /
translated: then when he separates from his body, he will fall into a bad rebirth, taking birth among the hungry ghosts that eat smells.

original: cho nges 'debs /
analyzed: cho nges 'debs /
translated: “Born in that way, his body will always be tormented by hunger and thirst, and he will run around wherever he can, crying,🔽screaming,

original: smre sngags 'don to //
analyzed: smre sngags 'don to //

translated: “If someone who is naturally unwholesome speaks ill of that hungry ghost,

analyzed: de gzhi des mi de la 'tsho bar byed pa dang / 'jig rten pa de dag gnod sbyin 'di ni rdzu 'phrul che ba mthu che ba zhig go zhes brjod do //
translated: then, on that basis, the hungry ghost will harm that person, and people will say, ‘This yakṣa is very powerful and very influential.’

original: de phreng ba mang po thob ste /
analyzed: de phreng ba mang po thob ste /
translated: “He will obtain many garlands.

original: de des shin tu tshim par 'gyur zhing lus bkres pa dang / skom pas gdungs par yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de des shin tu tshim par 'gyur zhing lus bkres pa dang / skom pas gdungs par yang mi 'gyur /
translated: They will be very satisfied and their bodies will not be tormented by hunger and thirst.

original: 'jig rten gyis kyang mngon par bstod par @479b 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyis kyang mngon par bstod par @479b 'gyur te /
translated: They will be praised by the world.

original: de des rtag tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de des rtag tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will always be happy.

original: der yi dvags phreng ba za ba de srid du sdig pa'i las sdig pa chung ba de bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der yi dvags phreng ba za ba de srid du sdig pa'i las sdig pa chung ba de bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “As long as the karmic actions of the starving spirits who eat garlands have not been overcome, eliminated, and exhausted, they will continue to live in this way.

original: de phyis yi dvags kyi 'jig rten de las thar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de phyis yi dvags kyi 'jig rten de las thar bar 'gyur te /
translated: When they finally escape the world of starving spirits,

original: thar nas kyang las de dang rgyu mthun par byas pa nye bar 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin de la spyod cing 'khor ba na yongs su 'khyam mo //
analyzed: thar nas kyang las de dang rgyu mthun par byas pa nye bar 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin de la spyod cing 'khor ba na yongs su 'khyam mo //
translated: they will continue to experience the consequences of their actions, wandering in cyclic existence.

original: de gal te brgya la mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mir skyes na de phreng ba mkhan du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de gal te brgya la mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mir skyes na de phreng ba mkhan du 'gyur te /
translated: If, with extremely rare good fortune, they should be born with the general lot in life of a human, they will become garland makers.

original: mu dang / mtha' dang / mjug des de'i 'tsho ba nye bar 'grub pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: mu dang / mtha' dang / mjug des de'i 'tsho ba nye bar 'grub pa mthong ngo //
translated: They will see that their livelihood is based on garlands, and that is how they will make a living.

original: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des yi dvags kyi 'jig rten la brtags na /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des yi dvags kyi 'jig rten la brtags na /
translated: “As the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects continues to examine the world of starving spirits, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing and thus perceive the starving spirits that feed on blood.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas yi dvags kyi 'jig rten na yi dvags khrag za ba zhes bya ba khrag gis srog 'tsho bar byed pa ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas yi dvags kyi 'jig rten na yi dvags khrag za ba zhes bya ba khrag gis srog 'tsho bar byed pa ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
translated: He will then notice, ‘Those spirits sustain themselves by drinking blood.

original: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: What karmic actions cause beings to be born in that way?’

original: mi gang la la de'i lus brten par bya ba'i phyir sha'i khrag 'thung la de la dga' zhing gtum pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser snas mngon par nyams pa /
analyzed: mi gang la la de'i lus brten par bya ba'i phyir sha'i khrag 'thung la de la dga' zhing gtum pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser snas mngon par nyams pa /
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will then notice, ‘Some people drink the blood of others’ flesh in order to sustain their own bodies. They enjoy doing so and are violent, envious, and miserly.

original: bu dang / chung ma la slu bar byed cing srog gcod par byed na /
analyzed: bu dang / chung ma la slu bar byed cing srog gcod par byed na /
translated: They deceive their children and spouses and kill.

original: khrag la 'chums pa'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: khrag la 'chums pa'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: They are obsessed with blood.

original: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba @480a *//
analyzed: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba @480a *//
translated: When they later separate from their bodies, they will fall into the lower realms and be born among the starving spirits that feed on blood.

original: yi dvags khrag za ba rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yi dvags khrag za ba rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be born among the hungry ghosts who drink blood.

original: der skyes nas kyang de las nyid kyis bskyed pa'i yul du skye bar 'gyur la de la mi dag 'di ni gnod sbyin zhig yin no zhes brjod de /
analyzed: der skyes nas kyang de las nyid kyis bskyed pa'i yul du skye bar 'gyur la de la mi dag 'di ni gnod sbyin zhig yin no zhes brjod de /
translated: When he is born there, he will be born in a place created by his own karma. People will say, ‘This is a yakṣa.’

original: de la mchod pa'ang byed do //
analyzed: de la mchod pa'ang byed do //
translated: They will make offerings to him.

original: de la kun nas bskor nas khrag gi gtor mas kyang mchod par byed de /
analyzed: de la kun nas bskor nas khrag gi gtor mas kyang mchod par byed de /
translated: They will surround him and make offerings to him with blood sacrifices.

original: de phyir zhing khrag 'thung bas myos nas mi dag la gnod pa byed do //
analyzed: de phyir zhing khrag 'thung bas myos nas mi dag la gnod pa byed do //
translated: He will become even more intoxicated by drinking blood and will harm people.

original: de la mi dag yang dang / yang gnod sbyin 'di ni rdzu 'phrul che zhing mthu che ba zhig yin no zhes brjod de /
analyzed: de la mi dag yang dang / yang gnod sbyin 'di ni rdzu 'phrul che zhing mthu che ba zhig yin no zhes brjod de /
translated: People will say, ‘This yakṣa has great magical power and great strength.’

original: de ltar de gcig nas gcig tu rjod par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar de gcig nas gcig tu rjod par byed do //
translated: In this way, they will pass on the story.

original: tshe'ang snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: tshe'ang snga ma bzhin te /
translated: His lifespan is as described above.

original: de ltar de ji srid du sdig pa'i las de bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du de ltar yi dvags rdzu 'phrul che ba de nyid byed do //
analyzed: de ltar de ji srid du sdig pa'i las de bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du de ltar yi dvags rdzu 'phrul che ba de nyid byed do //
translated: In this way, he will continue to be a hungry ghost with great magical power until his evil karma has been overcome, relinquished, and exhausted.

original: de de las thar na las de dang rgyu mthun par rang gi las la spyod pa las nye bar 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'khor ba na yongs su 'khyam mo //
analyzed: de de las thar na las de dang rgyu mthun par rang gi las la spyod pa las nye bar 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'khor ba na yongs su 'khyam mo //
translated: If they escape from that, they will, in accordance with their causal actions, continue to wander in cyclic existence, experiencing the following effects that accord with their causal actions.

original: de gal te brgya la mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mir skyes pa'am /
analyzed: de gal te brgya la mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mir skyes pa'am /
translated: If, with extremely low likelihood, they should be born with the general lot in life of a human,

original: bud med du skyes na mi de mkha' 'gro ma'am /🔽mkha' 'gror 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: bud med du skyes na mi de mkha' 'gro ma'am / mkha' 'gror 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
translated: they will be born as a man or a woman who is a ḍākinī or a ḍāka.🔽This is the result of their causal actions.

original: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des yi dvags kyi 'jig rten la brtags na /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des yi dvags kyi 'jig rten la brtags na /
translated: “The monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will then examine the world of starving spirits.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas yi dvags kyi 'jig rten na yi dvags sha za ba zhes bya ba ji ltar @480b 'dug pa mthong ngo //🔽de las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas yi dvags kyi 'jig rten na yi dvags sha za ba zhes bya ba ji ltar @480b 'dug pa mthong ngo // de las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will then see the starving spirits in the world of starving spirits that feed on flesh.

original: ser sna la chags pa'i zil gyis non pa gang gis ba lang ngam /
analyzed: ser sna la chags pa'i zil gyis non pa gang gis ba lang ngam /
translated: Inquiring into what type of karmic action may cause one to be born there, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing and thus perceive how some people are overcome by attachment to stinginess.🔽They may be attached to cows,

original: rta'am /  yi dvags sam /
analyzed: rta'am /  yi dvags sam /
translated: horses, or other animals,

original: phag gam / lug shi ba'i sha rin thang ngam /
analyzed: phag gam / lug shi ba'i sha rin thang ngam /
translated: Or, if he sells meat from pigs or sheep that have died on their own,

original: srang la g-yo byas nas rin chen por btsongs na /
analyzed: srang la g-yo byas nas rin chen por btsongs na /
translated: or if he sells precious substances that he has tampered with on the scales,

original: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba yi dvags sha za ba rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba yi dvags sha za ba rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then when he separates from his body, he will fall into the lower realms and be born among the hungry ghosts that eat flesh.

original: de bzhi mdo dang / sum mdo dang / tshong 'dus dang / lam gyi bzhi mdo dang / srang dang / grong khyer dang / gtsug lag khang gi gnas rnams kyi gnod sbyin du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhi mdo dang / sum mdo dang / tshong 'dus dang / lam gyi bzhi mdo dang / srang dang / grong khyer dang / gtsug lag khang gi gnas rnams kyi gnod sbyin du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: He will be born as a yakṣa in the middle of crossroads, in the middle of three-way crossroads, in marketplaces, at the junctions of four roads, in the streets, in the cities, and in the temples.

original: ngo bo nyid gtum la gyur pa shes so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gtum la gyur pa shes so //
translated: He will be born as a yakṣa with a fierce nature.

original: yi dvags rdzu 'phrul che ba mi dge ba'i las shin tu mi zad pa'ang ma yin la /
analyzed: yi dvags rdzu 'phrul che ba mi dge ba'i las shin tu mi zad pa'ang ma yin la /
translated: “ ‘There are also hungry ghosts with miraculous powers who have not exhausted their nonvirtuous karma.

original: de sbyin pa tsher ma lta bu'ang byin te /
analyzed: de sbyin pa tsher ma lta bu'ang byin te /
translated: They give gifts that are like thorns.

original: rgyu des rdzu 'phrul che ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu des rdzu 'phrul che ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of that, they will have miraculous powers.

original: de la mi phal pa dag ma he dang / ri dvags dang / sbrul dang / lug la sogs pa dag srog bcad nas shas shin tu tshim par byed do //
analyzed: de la mi phal pa dag ma he dang / ri dvags dang / sbrul dang / lug la sogs pa dag srog bcad nas shas shin tu tshim par byed do //
translated: Ordinary people there kill buffalo, deer, snakes, sheep, and so forth, and are very satisfied with their meat.

original: de ltar de nyes par byas pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis ji srid du mi dge ba'i las phrag dog byas pa de bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du der 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar de nyes par byas pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis ji srid du mi dge ba'i las phrag dog byas pa de bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du der 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, due to the nature of their misdeeds, they remain there as long as their nonvirtuous actions—the envy they created—have not been overcome, relinquished, and exhausted.

original: de phyis yi dvags kyi 'jig rten de  las thar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de phyis yi dvags kyi 'jig rten de  las thar bar 'gyur te /
translated: “When they finally escape the world of starving spirits,🔽they will, in accordance with their causal actions, continue to wander in cyclic existence,

original: thar nas kyang las de dang rgyu mthun par las nye bar 'gro ba dang / las so sor 'brang ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'khor ba na yongs @481a *//🔽su 'khyam mo //
analyzed: thar nas kyang las de dang rgyu mthun par las nye bar 'gro ba dang / las so sor 'brang ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'khor ba na yongs @481a *// su 'khyam mo //
translated: where they will be bound by the fetters of their actions and follow their actions.

original: gal te brgya la las legs par byas pa des gnya' shing gi bu gar rus sbal 'jug pa lta bur mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mir skyes na /
analyzed: gal te brgya la las legs par byas pa des gnya' shing gi bu gar rus sbal 'jug pa lta bur mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mir skyes na /
translated: “If, with the likelihood of a sea turtle poking its head through a yoke floating on the ocean, they should be born with the general lot in life of a human,

original: sha za bshan pa phal pa'am /
analyzed: sha za bshan pa phal pa'am /
translated: they will become butchers or meat eaters.

original: dum bur byed pa'i mir 'gyur ba mthong ngo //🔽de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des yi dvags kyi 'jig rten la brtags na /
analyzed: dum bur byed pa'i mir 'gyur ba mthong ngo // de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des yi dvags kyi 'jig rten la brtags na /
translated: He will be seen to be the one who cuts them into pieces.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas yi dvags bdug pa za ba zhes bya ba de thob pas des srog 'tsho ba 'thob pa ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas yi dvags bdug pa za ba zhes bya ba de thob pas des srog 'tsho ba 'thob pa ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
translated: “As the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects continues to examine the world of starving spirits, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing and thus correctly perceive the starving spirits that feed on incense. He will then notice how they obtain their livelihood.

original: de las gang gis der skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: de las gang gis der skye bar 'gyur snyam nas / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: Inquiring into what type of karmic action may cause one to be born in that way,

original: 'di ltar lhus cher ser snas zil gyis non cing las kyi 'bras bu mngon par mi shes pa; sangs rgyas zhes bya ba 'di zhing ma yin no snyam nas zhing du mngon par ma shes pa gang gis bdug spos bzang po bzhag la bdug spos ngan pa khyer
analyzed: 'di ltar lhus cher ser snas zil gyis non cing las kyi 'bras bu mngon par mi shes pa; sangs rgyas zhes bya ba 'di zhing ma yin no snyam nas zhing du mngon par ma shes pa gang gis bdug spos bzang po bzhag la bdug spos ngan pa khyer
translated: he will apply knowledge derived from hearing and thus perceive how some people are overcome by intense stinginess and are ignorant of the effects of karmic actions. Thinking, ‘This is not a buddha field,’ they fail to recognize a buddha field. They may offer good incense but then take away bad incense.

original: te / sems dang ba med cing dad pa med par gyur pa /
analyzed: te / sems dang ba med cing dad pa med par gyur pa /
translated: They are not pure in mind and lack faith.

original: las kyi 'bras bu yang dag par myong bar 'dod pa /
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu yang dag par myong bar 'dod pa /
translated: “Those who wish to experience the effects of their actions,

original: gzhan gyi ngor 'di ltar bdug spos phul bas bdag gi las kyi 'bras bur 'gyur snyam na; de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba yi dvags rdzu 'phrul che ba me tog phreng ba dang / phye ma dang / byug pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngor 'di ltar bdug spos phul bas bdag gi las kyi 'bras bur 'gyur snyam na; de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba yi dvags rdzu 'phrul che ba me tog phreng ba dang / phye ma dang / byug pa dang /
translated: and who think, ‘By offering incense in this way, I will experience the effects of my actions,’ will, when separating from their bodies, fall into the lower realms and be born as yakṣas who enjoy garlands, powders, ointments,🔽incense, and music, and who eat incense.

original: spos dang / rol mo'i sgra la rab tu dga' zhing bdug @481b pa za ba'i gnod sbyin du 'gyur te /🔽gnod sbyin gyi gnas sum mdo dang / bzhi mdo'am /
analyzed: spos dang / rol mo'i sgra la rab tu dga' zhing bdug @481b pa za ba'i gnod sbyin du 'gyur te / gnod sbyin gyi gnas sum mdo dang / bzhi mdo'am /
translated: They will live in the places of the yakṣas, at crossroads,

original: lam po che'am /
analyzed: lam po che'am /
translated: on the main roads,🔽in temples,

original: srang ngam / gtsug lag khang ngam /🔽kun dga' ra ba'am /🔽skyed mos tshal lam /
analyzed: srang ngam / gtsug lag khang ngam / kun dga' ra ba'am / skyed mos tshal lam /
translated: in parks,🔽in houses,

original: khyim mam / mkhar ram /
analyzed: khyim mam / mkhar ram /
translated: in forts,

original: pu shu dag tu aa ga ru nag po'i bdug spos kyis myos par 'gyur zhing skye bo kun gyis phyag byas par 'gyur ba ni sems dang / rdzas kyi yon tan gyis ma yin gyi zhing bzang po'i yon tan yin te /
analyzed: pu shu dag tu aa ga ru nag po'i bdug spos kyis myos par 'gyur zhing skye bo kun gyis phyag byas par 'gyur ba ni sems dang / rdzas kyi yon tan gyis ma yin gyi zhing bzang po'i yon tan yin te /
translated: or in watchtowers. There they will be intoxicated by the incense of black agarwood and will be revered by everyone, not because of their own qualities of mind or substance, but because of the good qualities of the field.

original: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la chung ngu zhig phul na'ang 'bras bu chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la chung ngu zhig phul na'ang 'bras bu chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if one offers a small gift to the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha, the result will be great.

original: dper na / gang gi tshe shing n+ya gro dha'i sa bon chung ngu zhing gshin pa la btab pa de'i tshe shing ljon pa yal ga bzang zhing lo ma'i tshogs chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na / gang gi tshe shing n+ya gro dha'i sa bon chung ngu zhing gshin pa la btab pa de'i tshe shing ljon pa yal ga bzang zhing lo ma'i tshogs chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, when a small seed of a banyan tree is planted in fertile soil, then that tree will become a great tree with many branches and a great abundance of leaves.

original: de bzhin du de zhing bzang po sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la phul ba'i 'bras bu'ang zhing gi yon tan dang / mthus chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du de zhing bzang po sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la phul ba'i 'bras bu'ang zhing gi yon tan dang / mthus chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the result of offering to the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha, which is a fertile field, will be great due to the qualities and power of the field.

original: de ltar yi dvags rdzu 'phrul che ba de bde ba nyams su myong ste las zad pas yi dvags kyi 'jig rten de las thar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yi dvags rdzu 'phrul che ba de bde ba nyams su myong ste las zad pas yi dvags kyi 'jig rten de las thar bar 'gyur te /
translated: “In this way, the hungry ghost with great magical powers experiences pleasure, and when his karma is exhausted, he escapes from that world of hungry ghosts.

original: thar nas kyang las de dang rgyu mthun par nye bar 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'khor ba na yongs su 'khyam mo //
analyzed: thar nas kyang las de dang rgyu mthun par nye bar 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'khor ba na yongs su 'khyam mo //
translated: After escaping, he wanders in cyclic existence in accordance with his causal actions.

original: de gal te mi'i nang du gnya' shing gi bu gar rus sbal 'jug pa lta bur mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mir skyes na /
analyzed: de gal te mi'i nang du gnya' shing gi bu gar rus sbal 'jug pa lta bur mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mir skyes na /
translated: If, with the likelihood of a sea turtle poking its head through a yoke floating on the ocean, they should be born with the general lot in life of a human,

original: de rtag tu de dbul ba'i rigs su skye zhing rtag tu me tog phreng ba dang / phye ma dang / byug pas lus byugs te lus @482a *//
analyzed: de rtag tu de dbul ba'i rigs su skye zhing rtag tu me tog phreng ba dang / phye ma dang / byug pas lus byugs te lus @482a *//
translated: they will always be born into a family of beggars and will always have their bodies anointed with flower garlands, powders, and ointments.

original: shin tu dri zhim par 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: shin tu dri zhim par 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
translated: Their bodies will be very fragrant.

original: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des yi dvags kyi 'jig rten la brtags na /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas yi dvags drag shul spyod pa zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des yi dvags kyi 'jig rten la brtags na / des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas yi dvags drag shul spyod pa zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
translated: “The monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will then examine the world of starving spirits.

original: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will then see the starving spirits known as violent, and so he will ask himself, ‘What karmic actions cause beings to take birth in that way?’

original: mi ngan pa ser snas zil gyis gnon cing dge sbyong gi tshul 'dzin pa tshul khrims 'chal ba gang gis dge sbyong gzhan la tha snyad btags nas 'di ltar dge sbyong zhig shin tu nad mi bzad pas thebs te /
analyzed: mi ngan pa ser snas zil gyis gnon cing dge sbyong gi tshul 'dzin pa tshul khrims 'chal ba gang gis dge sbyong gzhan la tha snyad btags nas 'di ltar dge sbyong zhig shin tu nad mi bzad pas thebs te /

analyzed: de blangs te bdag nyid za bar byed de /

analyzed: zla des ngan g-yo byed par gyur nas tshul sna tshogs bzung ste yul nas yul du rgyug cing sbyin bdag rnams la slu bar byed na /

analyzed: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba yi dvags drag shul spyod pa rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //

original: der skyes nas kha zas ljan ljin mi gtsang ba za bar 'gyur /
analyzed: der skyes nas kha zas ljan ljin mi gtsang ba za bar 'gyur /

original: rtag tu lus bkres pa dang / skom pas gdungs par 'gyur /
analyzed: rtag tu lus bkres pa dang / skom pas gdungs par 'gyur /

analyzed: mi gang mi gtsang ba de la brnyes par byed cing de ltar nga rgyal med par byed /

analyzed: lus dang spu thams cad rab tu 'bar la yul 'jig pa'i tshe rab tu dga' bar 'gyur /

analyzed: drag shul du spyod pa'i rig sngags dag gis gzhan dag drangs nas rnam par 'tshe bar byed /

analyzed: yud tsam zhig gis dpag tshad brgya phrag stong nas kyang drangs te 'ong bar byed do //

analyzed: de ltar drag shul spyod pa'i yi dvags de gnod sbyin gyi ming thob ste /

analyzed: de ltar de skye bo rnam pa sna tshogs la gnod pa byed cing rnam par 'tshe ba na ji srid du tshe ma zad pa de srid du 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de phyis de las 'chi bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: de las gang gis der skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las @483a *//

original: byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /

analyzed: 'di ltar phrag dog dang / ser snas zil gyis non pas gzhan gyi nor rdzas la g-yo thabs dang / ngan g-yo dang / slu ba dang; 'khu ba byas shing grong dang / grong khyer dang / tshong 'dus pa la brid de glags rnyed pa dang /

analyzed: pha rol 'jig par byed cing sbyin pa dag mi gtong /

original: mkhas pa la lhur mi lta /
analyzed: mkhas pa la lhur mi lta /

analyzed: rtag tu ser snas zil gyis non cing gzhan la 'khu ba'i bsam pas gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa mthong nas yid gzhan du sems /

analyzed: de res 'ga' gal te mi blo zhan pa zhig dang phrad la /

analyzed: de phyis yi dvags kyi 'jig rten de las thar bar 'gyur te /

translated: “As the monk who has knowledge of the effects of the ripening of karmic actions continues to examine the world of starving spirits, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing and thus correctly perceive how the world of starving spirits includes what are called the starving spirits that live underground.

translated: One’s own karmic actions deceive the mind, and one is covered by darkness as if by hair. All the major and minor body parts are connected by a network of sinews. analyzed: thar nas kyang las de dang rgyu mthun par gal te mi rnams kyi nang du gnya' shing gi bu gar rus sbal 'jug pa lta bur mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mir skyes na /

analyzed: de de bzhin du gling gi bar na gnas pa'i mir 'gyur te /

original: gang zhig sdig las bral ba ni //
analyzed: gang zhig sdig las bral ba ni //
translated: Those who are free from evil actions

original: shin tu dge la dga' 'gyur te //
analyzed: shin tu dge la dga' 'gyur te //
translated: And will delight in virtue.

original: de ni bde bas bde 'thob cing //
analyzed: de ni bde bas bde 'thob cing //
translated: He will attain happiness through happiness

original: mya ngan 'das par rab tu 'gro /
analyzed: mya ngan 'das par rab tu 'gro /
translated: And will proceed to nirvana.

original: gang zhig dge la nyer bsten pa //
analyzed: gang zhig dge la nyer bsten pa //
translated: The person who relies on virtue

original: mi ni shin tu bkra shis 'gyur //
analyzed: mi ni shin tu bkra shis 'gyur //
translated: Will be extremely fortunate.

original: gang zhig sdig la nyer bsten pa //
analyzed: gang zhig sdig la nyer bsten pa //
translated: The person who relies on evil

original: de ni shin tu bkra mi shis //
analyzed: de ni shin tu bkra mi shis //
translated: Will be extremely unfortunate.

original: thog ma bar dang mthar ngan pa //
analyzed: thog ma bar dang mthar ngan pa //
translated: Evil in the beginning, middle, and end,

original: dam pas de ni rnam par smad //
analyzed: dam pas de ni rnam par smad //
translated: It is condemned by the holy ones.

original: sdig pa sdig par 'gro ba mthong //
analyzed: sdig pa sdig par 'gro ba mthong //
translated: Evil is seen to lead to evil,

original: sems can dmyal ba nye bar @491a *//
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba nye bar @491a *//
translated: And to the hells.

original: rtog / las dge dbang po thul ba ni //
analyzed: rtog / las dge dbang po thul ba ni //
translated: The one who has good karma and controlled senses

original: 'jig rten dag na shin tu bzang //
analyzed: 'jig rten dag na shin tu bzang //
translated: Is extremely good in the world.

original: lus dang bral nas bde 'gro ste //
analyzed: lus dang bral nas bde 'gro ste //
translated: When he separates from his body, he goes to a good realm

original: lha yi 'jig rten skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: lha yi 'jig rten skye bar 'gyur //
translated: And is reborn in the world of the gods.

original: khyod ni bcing ba dam pos bcings //
analyzed: khyod ni bcing ba dam pos bcings //
translated: You are bound by strong bonds

original: gshin rje'i pho nyas dbang du byas //🔽gshin rje'i 'jig rten bsten dka' ba //
analyzed: gshin rje'i pho nyas dbang du byas // gshin rje'i 'jig rten bsten dka' ba //
translated: And are under the control of the messengers of the Lord of Death.🔽You have attained the fierce and terrible

original: drag po mi bzang khyod kyis thob //
analyzed: drag po mi bzang khyod kyis thob //
translated: World of the Lord of Death, which is difficult to rely on.

original: khyod kyi ngan byas gang byas pa //
analyzed: khyod kyi ngan byas gang byas pa //
translated: Whatever evil you have done

original: las de 'dir ni spyad par gyis //
analyzed: las de 'dir ni spyad par gyis //
translated: You must experience that karma here.

original: byis pa rang gis byas la spyad //
analyzed: byis pa rang gis byas la spyad //
translated: Children create their own experiences and

original: gzhan gyis spyod pa nyid mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan gyis spyod pa nyid mi 'gyur //
translated: others cannot experience them.

original: de ltar de gshin rjes rjes su bstan pa na gshi na'i chad pa de dag mngon sum du gyur to //
analyzed: de ltar de gshin rjes rjes su bstan pa na gshi na'i chad pa de dag mngon sum du gyur to //
translated: Thus, when Yama teaches in this way, the punishments of Yama become manifest.

original: de nas de bstan nas gshin rje'i mis nyes par byed pa byas pa rang gi las kyi 'bras bus bslus pa de phyir byung nas las nye bar 'gro ba ji lta pa bzhin du khrid de /
analyzed: de nas de bstan nas gshin rje'i mis nyes par byed pa byas pa rang gi las kyi 'bras bus bslus pa de phyir byung nas las nye bar 'gro ba ji lta pa bzhin du khrid de /
translated: Then, after being shown this, the henchmen of Yama lead out the deceived perpetrators of misdeeds, who are deceived by the results of their own actions, and take them away to where they will experience the results of their actions.

original: ji srid du sdig pa'i las byas shing bsags pa de bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du zas rlung la za bar byed do //
analyzed: ji srid du sdig pa'i las byas shing bsags pa de bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du zas rlung la za bar byed do //
translated: As long as the evil actions that they committed and accumulated have not been destroyed, relinquished, and exhausted, they will continue to eat the wind.

original: de phyis yi dvags kyi 'jig rten de las thar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de phyis yi dvags kyi 'jig rten de las thar bar 'gyur te /
translated: After that, they will escape from the world of the hungry ghosts.

original: thar nas kyang gal te mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mir skyes na /
analyzed: thar nas kyang gal te mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par mir skyes na /
translated: If, after escaping from there, they are born with the general lot in life of a human,

original: las de dang rgyu mthun par ri nyam pa nga ba dang / chu mi bde ba'i 'gram du gnas te lam du 'gro ba bskyed par 'gyur ba mthong ngo //🔽de nas yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa dge slong des @491b sa gzhan bcu bzhi pa la ji ltar 'jug snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sam /
analyzed: las de dang rgyu mthun par ri nyam pa nga ba dang / chu mi bde ba'i 'gram du gnas te lam du 'gro ba bskyed par 'gyur ba mthong ngo // de nas yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa dge slong des @491b sa gzhan bcu bzhi pa la ji ltar 'jug snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas sam /
translated: In accordance with their causal actions, they will then be born in a place where the roads are narrow and the water is unpleasant.

original: lha'i mig gis gzugs kyi skye mched bcu mthong ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis gzugs kyi skye mched bcu mthong ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Next, the spiritual practitioner who carefully observes the internal phenomena will think, ‘How does one enter the fourteenth stage?’ With knowledge derived from hearing or by seeing with the divine eye, he will see the ten bases of form.🔽What are the ten?

original: mig gi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched dang / rna ba'i skye mched dang / sgra'i skye mched dang / sna'i skye mched dang / dri'i skye mched dang / lce'i skye mched dang / ro'i skye mched dang / lus kyi skye mched dang /
analyzed: mig gi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched dang / rna ba'i skye mched dang / sgra'i skye mched dang / sna'i skye mched dang / dri'i skye mched dang / lce'i skye mched dang / ro'i skye mched dang / lus kyi skye mched dang /
translated: The eye base, the form base, the ear base, the sound base, the nose base, the smell base, the tongue base, the taste base, the body base,

original: reg bya'i skye mched do //
analyzed: reg bya'i skye mched do //
translated: and the tactile base.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He will think,

original: mig dang / gzugs la brten nas bdag gi 'du shes byung ngo snyam ste /
analyzed: mig dang / gzugs la brten nas bdag gi 'du shes byung ngo snyam ste /
translated: The thought occurs to him, The notion of self arises in dependence on the eye and forms.

original: des brtags na mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ste /
analyzed: des brtags na mig dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ste /
translated: When he investigates, he sees, The eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms.

original: gsum 'dus pa las reg pa /
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa las reg pa /
translated: From the coming together of the three, contact arises.

original: reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: reg pa dang lhan cig skyes pa tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
translated: Along with contact, feeling, perception, intention, and consciousness arise.

original: reg bar byed pas reg pa dang / tshor bar byed pas tshor ba /
analyzed: reg bar byed pas reg pa dang / tshor bar byed pas tshor ba /
translated: Because it makes contact, it is contact; because it feels, it is feeling;

original: shes par byed pas 'du shes te /
analyzed: shes par byed pas 'du shes te /
translated: because it perceives, it is perception;🔽because it thinks, it is thought; and because it is conscious, it is consciousness.🔽 This form is long or short,

original: 'di ltar gzugs 'di ni ring ngo thung ngo //🔽sdug go mi sdug go /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs 'di ni ring ngo thung ngo // sdug go mi sdug go /
translated: beautiful or ugly,🔽visible or invisible,

original: bstan du yod pa'o //🔽thogs pa dang bcas pa'o snyam pa'o //
analyzed: bstan du yod pa'o // thogs pa dang bcas pa'o snyam pa'o //
translated: resistant or non-resistant.

original: sems par byed pas sems pa'o //
analyzed: sems par byed pas sems pa'o //
translated: Because it thinks, it is thought.

original: yang rnam par shes par byed pas rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: yang rnam par shes par byed pas rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Because it is conscious, it is consciousness.

original: chos de dag dmigs pa gcig la 'jug cing 'byung bar 'gyur te /🔽mtshan nyid gzhan dang gzhan /
analyzed: chos de dag dmigs pa gcig la 'jug cing 'byung bar 'gyur te / mtshan nyid gzhan dang gzhan /
translated: These phenomena operate and arise with regard to a single object,🔽but they have different characteristics

original: ngo bo nyid gzhan dang gzhan yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gzhan dang gzhan yin no //
translated: and different natures.

original: 'di ltar sa chen po'i chos bcu ni @492a *//
analyzed: 'di ltar sa chen po'i chos bcu ni @492a *//
translated: Thus, the ten dharmas of the great earth

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / 'dun pa dang / mos pa dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / 'dun pa dang / mos pa dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab ste /
translated: are feeling, perception, intention, contact, mental attention, aspiration, belief, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: de ltar dmigs pa gcig la mtshan nyid gzhan du 'dod do //
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa gcig la mtshan nyid gzhan du 'dod do //
translated: Thus, in a single object, they assert different characteristics.

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa chos bcu gcig po de dag kyang ji ltar nyi ma'i 'od zer gcig tu 'du'ang 'on kyang ngo bo nyid gzhan pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid gzhan pa nas sems pa'i bar du gzhan no snyam ste
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa chos bcu gcig po de dag kyang ji ltar nyi ma'i 'od zer gcig tu 'du'ang 'on kyang ngo bo nyid gzhan pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid gzhan pa nas sems pa'i bar du gzhan no snyam ste
translated: Those eleven dharmas beginning with consciousness are also like the sun’s rays, which are one in the sense that they are the rays of the sun, but are different in the sense that they have different natures. In the same way, the nature of consciousness is different from the nature of intention.

original: / dge slong gzugs kyi skye mched kyi de kho na nyid shes pa des mig gsog dang / gsob dang / snying po med pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin par mthong ngo //
analyzed: / dge slong gzugs kyi skye mched kyi de kho na nyid shes pa des mig gsog dang / gsob dang / snying po med pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin par mthong ngo //
translated: The monk who knows the thatness of the form sense-sphere sees the eye as hollow, as empty, as having no core, as unreal.

original: phyogs bcur lam gyi de nyid shes shing log par lta ba spangs pa /
analyzed: phyogs bcur lam gyi de nyid shes shing log par lta ba spangs pa /
translated: He knows the thatness of the path in the ten directions and abandons wrong views.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba sngon du 'dren pas mig gi rnam pa gti mug gi rnyog par gyur pa spong ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba sngon du 'dren pas mig gi rnam pa gti mug gi rnyog par gyur pa spong ste /
translated: Since the correct view is brought to the fore, the eye’s aspect that is the turbidity of delusion is abandoned.

original: de kho na nyid mthong ba des sha'i gong bur byas pa rnag nyung ngu dang / mchi ma mang po'i gnas yin no snyam du rig nas de la 'dod chags skyes pa rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: de kho na nyid mthong ba des sha'i gong bur byas pa rnag nyung ngu dang / mchi ma mang po'i gnas yin no snyam du rig nas de la 'dod chags skyes pa rab tu spong ngo //
translated: By seeing reality, one thinks, “This is the abode of a little pus and much tear fluid, which is made of a lump of flesh,” and one completely abandons the attachment that arises toward it.

original: mi rtag pa yin no snyam nas mi rtag par lta bar byed /
analyzed: mi rtag pa yin no snyam nas mi rtag par lta bar byed /
translated: Thinking, “It is impermanent,” one views it as impermanent.

original: sha'i gong bu dang / rus pa'i bu ga'i rnam pa yin no snyam nas 'dod chags dang bral bar byed /
analyzed: sha'i gong bu dang / rus pa'i bu ga'i rnam pa yin no snyam nas 'dod chags dang bral bar byed /
translated: Thinking, “It is the aspect of a lump of flesh and a cavity in bone,” one becomes free of attachment.

original: rgyus pas sprel ba yin no snyam nas mig gi skye mched phan @492b tshun rag las pa 'di la rtog ste /
analyzed: rgyus pas sprel ba yin no snyam nas mig gi skye mched phan @492b tshun rag las pa 'di la rtog ste /
translated: Thinking, “It is connected by sinew,” one investigates the eye’s sense base, which is mutually dependent.

original: 'di la snying po med cing bdag med par rig go /
analyzed: 'di la snying po med cing bdag med par rig go /
translated: One knows that it has no essence and no self.

original: mdor na mig 'di ni sdug bsngal yin par shes shing mthong nas mig gi skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral lo //
analyzed: mdor na mig 'di ni sdug bsngal yin par shes shing mthong nas mig gi skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral lo //
translated: In brief, one knows and sees that this eye is suffering, and one becomes free of attachment to the eye’s sense base.

original: de mig gi skye mched ji lta ba bzhin gnas nas gzugs la'ang rnam par dpyod par byed de /
analyzed: de mig gi skye mched ji lta ba bzhin gnas nas gzugs la'ang rnam par dpyod par byed de /
translated: The eye faculty is situated in the eye, and form is analyzed.

original: gzugs gang sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa 'di ni kun tu rtog pa tsam ste /
analyzed: gzugs gang sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa 'di ni kun tu rtog pa tsam ste /
translated: “Whatever form is pleasant, unpleasant, or neutral is merely conceptualization.

original: 'di la snying po ci yod /
analyzed: 'di la snying po ci yod /
translated: What is the essence of this?

original: gtsang ba ci yod /🔽rtag pa ci yod /
analyzed: gtsang ba ci yod / rtag pa ci yod /
translated: What is pure about this?🔽What is permanent about this?

original: mi rtag pa ci yod ces lta ba na rnam par rtog cing dpyod par byed do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa ci yod ces lta ba na rnam par rtog cing dpyod par byed do //
translated: What is impermanent about this?”

original: dpyod pa na so so yang dag par rig par byed de /
analyzed: dpyod pa na so so yang dag par rig par byed de /
translated: When one analyzes in this way, one will understand.

original: gzugs 'di la ngo bo nyid kyis bde ba med pa des gzugs mthong zhing shes la rtog pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: gzugs 'di la ngo bo nyid kyis bde ba med pa des gzugs mthong zhing shes la rtog pa 'thob bo //
translated: “In this form there is no intrinsic pleasure. Thus, one sees, understands, and realizes form.

original: gzugs 'di la snying po med de /
analyzed: gzugs 'di la snying po med de /
translated: In this form there is no essence.

original: gzugs sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa 'di ni kun tu brtags pa tsam mo //
analyzed: gzugs sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa 'di ni kun tu brtags pa tsam mo //
translated: Pleasant and unpleasant form is merely conceptualization.

original: 'di la sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa'i ngo bo med de /
analyzed: 'di la sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa'i ngo bo med de /
translated: There is no essence of pleasant and unpleasant form.

original: 'jig rten 'di 'ba' zhig sdug pa dang; mi sdug par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di 'ba' zhig sdug pa dang; mi sdug par 'dod do //
translated: Only in this world is there desire for pleasant and unpleasant form.”

original: gzugs 'di ni ngo bo nyid kyis rtag pa'am /
analyzed: gzugs 'di ni ngo bo nyid kyis rtag pa'am /
translated: This form is not by nature permanent,

original: brtan pa'am / ther zug pa'am /
analyzed: brtan pa'am / ther zug pa'am /
translated: stable, eternal,

original: bde ba'am / snying po'am /
analyzed: bde ba'am / snying po'am /
translated: happy, or having an essence,🔽nor does it have a self.

original: bdag dang bcas pa ma yin te; 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis sgribs pa ni gzugs sdug go /
analyzed: bdag dang bcas pa ma yin te; 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis sgribs pa ni gzugs sdug go /
translated: Those who are obscured by desire, anger, and ignorance think, ‘Form is beautiful,’🔽or ‘Form is ugly.’

original: mi sdug go snyam du sems so snyam nas de gzugs kyi skye mched yang dag par brtag @493a *//
analyzed: mi sdug go snyam du sems so snyam nas de gzugs kyi skye mched yang dag par brtag @493a *//
translated: Thus, they should examine the form sense-sphere.

original: te; mig dang / gzugs mthong nas chags par mi byed /
analyzed: te; mig dang / gzugs mthong nas chags par mi byed /
translated: When they see form with the eye, they should not be attached

original: rmongs par mi byed /
analyzed: rmongs par mi byed /
translated: or confused.

original: snying po yod par mi sems so //
analyzed: snying po yod par mi sems so //
translated: They should not think that it has an essence.

original: mig dang / gzugs kyi skye mched la mngon par brtags nas mig gi rnam par shes pa la chags par mi byed cing 'dod chags dang bral bar byed do //
analyzed: mig dang / gzugs kyi skye mched la mngon par brtags nas mig gi rnam par shes pa la chags par mi byed cing 'dod chags dang bral bar byed do //
translated: Having examined the sense-sphere of the eye and form, they should not be attached to visual consciousness, but should be free from attachment.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa bdag ma yin ;mig gi rnam par shes pa bdag gi ma yin te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa bdag ma yin ;mig gi rnam par shes pa bdag gi ma yin te /
translated: Visual consciousness is not the self, and visual consciousness is not mine.

original: de bzhin du rig pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa bdag ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du rig pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa bdag ma yin /
translated: In the same way, cognition, sensation, perception, and intention are not the self,🔽and the self does not possess them.

original: sems pa bdag gi ma yin no bar rig go /
analyzed: sems pa bdag gi ma yin no bar rig go /
translated: He will then understand that the mind is not the self.

original: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des yi dvags kyi 'jig rten la brtags na /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des yi dvags kyi 'jig rten la brtags na /
translated: “Next, the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will examine the world of starving spirits.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas yi dvags kyi yul ni yi dvags byis pa la za ba zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas yi dvags kyi yul ni yi dvags byis pa la za ba zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will then see the realm of starving spirits known as Devouring Children.

original: de las gang gis der skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /🔽nad pa rnams kyis lha mchod pa'am /
analyzed: de las gang gis der skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na / nad pa rnams kyis lha mchod pa'am /
translated: Wondering what karmic actions may cause beings to take birth there, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing.🔽He will then notice how some people, in order to worship gods or yakṣas, will perform violent and exhausting acts.

original: gnod sbyin mchod pa'i phyir las mi zad pa drag po gang gis gzhan dag bslus nas nor rdzas phrogs sam /
analyzed: gnod sbyin mchod pa'i phyir las mi zad pa drag po gang gis gzhan dag bslus nas nor rdzas phrogs sam /
translated: They may deceive others in order to steal their wealth,

original: lug bsad na de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba yang sos su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lug bsad na de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba yang sos su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or they may kill sheep. When they later separate from their bodies, they will fall into the lower realms, taking birth in the Reviving Hell.

original: de nas thar nas kyang yi @493b dvags byis pa la za ba'i nang du skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de nas thar nas kyang yi @493b dvags byis pa la za ba'i nang du skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: When they escape that realm, they will be born among the starving spirits known as Devouring Children.

original: gang srog gcod pa gzhan zhig gal te mi'i so so yang dag par myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis mi'i skye gnas su skye na /
analyzed: gang srog gcod pa gzhan zhig gal te mi'i so so yang dag par myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis mi'i skye gnas su skye na /
translated: If someone who has killed another is reborn in the human realm due to karma to be experienced in other lives as a human,

original: de srog gcod pa mang du byas pa ji lta ba bzhin du yi dvags des gsod par byed de /🔽me mngal na gnas pa na gsod pa'am /🔽de btsas pa'i khyim du gsod pa'am /
analyzed: de srog gcod pa mang du byas pa ji lta ba bzhin du yi dvags des gsod par byed de / me mngal na gnas pa na gsod pa'am / de btsas pa'i khyim du gsod pa'am /
translated: then the hungry ghost will kill that person in accordance with the extent of their killing.🔽It will kill them while they are in the womb.🔽It will kill them in the house where they are born.

original: de gog thal thul na gsod pa'am /🔽de phud bu bcad pa na gsod pa'am /
analyzed: de gog thal thul na gsod pa'am / de phud bu bcad pa na gsod pa'am /
translated: It will kill them when they are crawling.

original: de yongs su rgyug pa na gsod par byed do /
analyzed: de yongs su rgyug pa na gsod par byed do /
translated: It will kill them when they are running around.

original: de ltar yi dvags de'i rim gyis bus pa de gsod par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar yi dvags de'i rim gyis bus pa de gsod par byed do //
translated: In this way, the hungry ghost will kill the child in stages.

original: de gang gi tshe nyes par byas pa'i las des yi dvags de glags tshol te glags rnyed nas bus pa de la za bar byed do //
analyzed: de gang gi tshe nyes par byas pa'i las des yi dvags de glags tshol te glags rnyed nas bus pa de la za bar byed do //
translated: When the hungry ghost finds an opportunity to harm the child due to that misdeed, it will eat the child.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /🔽kha cig mngal te de bzhin du //
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa / kha cig mngal te de bzhin du //
translated: Here is a verse:🔽Some are killed in the womb,

analyzed: gzhan ni btsas pa'i khyim dang gzhan //

analyzed: de bzhin gog ni thal thul dang // yongs su rgyug na 'chi bar 'gyur //

analyzed: de ltar skom pa dang / bkres pas gdungs pa'i lus de rang gis nyes par byas pa'i las myong bar 'gyur te / 'di ltar byis pa'i srog 'tsho bar gyur ba na nyes par byas pa las nyes par byas pa nye bar sgrub cing de ltar gyis pa la za ba'i yi dvags de nyes par byas pa las shin tu nyes par byas pa'i las gzhan rgyun mi 'chad pa ni
translated: Thus, the body, tormented by thirst and hunger, experiences the effects of its own misdeeds.🔽In this way, when the life of a child is sustained, misdeeds are accomplished and misdeeds are accumulated.

original: yi dvags kyi 'jig rten de myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yi dvags kyi 'jig rten de myong bar 'gyur te /

translated: Thus, as long as the nonvirtuous karma that he has accumulated has not been destroyed, relinquished, and exhausted, he will be born in the world of hungry ghosts.

translated: “The monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will then examine the world of starving spirits.

analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas yi dvags kyi yul na yi dvags mdangs za ba zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will then see that the realm of starving spirits includes what are called the starving spirits that feed on radiance.

analyzed: de las gang gis der skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: Wondering what karmic actions may cause beings to take birth in that way, he will examine this matter with knowledge derived from hearing.

original: dang gra  mdza' bo ltar bcos pa ngo gnyis pa gang gis 'di ltar khyod g-yul 'gyed par zhugs shig dang / khyod kyi phyi bzhin bdag gis yang dag par bsrung bar bya'o zhes @495a *//

translated: He will then notice how some people pretend to be friends and allies, saying, ‘You should join the battle, and I will protect you.’

original: yongs su bslus nas de gzi byin dang mthu nyid skyes so //
analyzed: yongs su bslus nas de gzi byin dang mthu nyid skyes so //
translated: Having deceived him, he will be born with great splendor and power.

translated: “When he is born, he will engage in warfare and will give up his life. He will think, ‘If I capture him, I will take his wealth to the king’s court and make it my own.’

original: bdag gir bya'o snyam nas mi bslus pa de des bsad na lus slu ba de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba yi dvags mdangs za ba rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag gir bya'o snyam nas mi bslus pa de des bsad na lus slu ba de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba yi dvags mdangs za ba rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: “When he kills the man he has deceived, upon the disintegration of his body, he will fall into the lower realms and be born among the hungry ghosts that feed on light.

original: de lus bkres pa dang / skom pas shin tu gdungs shing lus mtshon gyis rtag tu gshegs la lus kyi pags pa dang / sha dang / rus pa rnam par nyams pa mtshon cha 'bab pa rnams kyi phyogs su 'gro ba na gar bab bab tu 'bros so //
analyzed: de lus bkres pa dang / skom pas shin tu gdungs shing lus mtshon gyis rtag tu gshegs la lus kyi pags pa dang / sha dang / rus pa rnam par nyams pa mtshon cha 'bab pa rnams kyi phyogs su 'gro ba na gar bab bab tu 'bros so //
translated: “His body will be tormented by hunger and thirst. His body will be constantly wounded by weapons. His body’s skin, flesh, and bones will be destroyed. He will run in the direction of the falling weapons, fleeing here and there.

original: de rnam pa gzhan du 'bros pa na /
analyzed: de rnam pa gzhan du 'bros pa na /
translated: “When he flees in other directions,

translated: When a human being who is not pure, who does not circumambulate stūpas, is found, the hungry ghost seizes the opportunity to steal his splendor.🔽He may live for ten years,

original: gal te lo nyi shur de 'tsho bar byed de /
analyzed: gal te lo nyi shur de 'tsho bar byed de /

original: de ltar shin tu sdug bsngal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar shin tu sdug bsngal bar 'gyur te /

original: ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las byas shing bsags pa nges par myong bar 'gyur ba las kyi nyer bsdogs dang / las kyi dngos gzhi dang / las kyi mjug dang yang dag par ldan pa bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du rang gi las kyi 'bras bu @495b la spyod pa /
analyzed: ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las byas shing bsags pa nges par myong bar 'gyur ba las kyi nyer bsdogs dang / las kyi dngos gzhi dang / las kyi mjug dang yang dag par ldan pa bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du rang gi las kyi 'bras bu @495b la spyod pa /
translated: As long as the misdeeds he has committed and accumulated have not been destroyed, relinquished, and exhausted, and as long as the preparations, the actual acts, and the conclusions of his actions have not been fully experienced, he will continue to experience the results of his own actions.

original: rang gis byas pa la za ba /
analyzed: rang gis byas pa la za ba /
translated: He will continue to consume what he himself has created.

original: rang gi las kyis skye ba'i rgyun shin tu 'khor ro //
analyzed: rang gi las kyis skye ba'i rgyun shin tu 'khor ro //
translated: He will continue to be born due to his own actions.

original: de phyis yi dvags kyi 'jig rten de las thar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de phyis yi dvags kyi 'jig rten de las thar bar 'gyur te /
translated: When he finally escapes the world of hungry ghosts,

original: thar nas kyang gal te lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis mi rnams kyi nang du skyes na /
analyzed: thar nas kyang gal te lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis mi rnams kyi nang du skyes na /
translated: If, after being free from that hell, due to karmic actions to be experienced in other lives, they should be born with the general lot in life of a human,

original: las de dang rgyu mthun par de lha rten gyi sar 'tsho ba dang / rtog ge pa dang / tshegs chen pos 'tsho ba dang / gzhan la rag las pas 'tsho bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo ////
analyzed: las de dang rgyu mthun par de lha rten gyi sar 'tsho ba dang / rtog ge pa dang / tshegs chen pos 'tsho ba dang / gzhan la rag las pas 'tsho bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo ////
translated: in accordance with their causal actions they will be born in a place where they must live by worshipping gods, or they will be born as logicians, or they will have to live by great hardship, or they will have to live in dependence on others.

original: 'phags pa dam pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa dam pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa /
translated: The Noble Dharmaskandha

original: bam po nyi shu pa /
analyzed: bam po nyi shu pa /
translated: The Twentieth Chapter

original: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des yi dvags kyi 'jig rten la brtags na /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des yi dvags kyi 'jig rten la brtags na /
translated: “The monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will then examine the world of starving spirits.
