analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas yi dvags kyi yul na yi dvags tshangs pa'i srin po zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will then see that the world of starving spirits has a realm called Brahma rākṣasa.

original: de las gang gis der skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: de las gang gis der skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: Wondering what karmic actions may cause beings to take birth there, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing.

original: mchod sbyin ngan par byed pa gang gis srog gcod pa dang yang dag par ldan pa shin tu gsod par dga' ba'i chos sbyin byas pa dang / zas dang / skom so sor khe spogs byed pa dang / rin chung ngus nyos la rin chen por 'tshong ba dang /🔽phrag dog dang / ser snas nyams pa de lus bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba yi dvags kyi 'jig rten na lus bkres pa dang / skom pas gdungs @496a *//
analyzed: mchod sbyin ngan par byed pa gang gis srog gcod pa dang yang dag par ldan pa shin tu gsod par dga' ba'i chos sbyin byas pa dang / zas dang / skom so sor khe spogs byed pa dang / rin chung ngus nyos la rin chen por 'tshong ba dang / phrag dog dang / ser snas nyams pa de lus bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba yi dvags kyi 'jig rten na lus bkres pa dang / skom pas gdungs @496a *//
translated: “The evil sacrifices that are performed in this way, which are accompanied by killing and the giving of Dharma to those who delight in killing, as well as the giving of food and drink that is done for the sake of profit, the buying of cheap goods to sell at a high price,

original: pa tshangs pa'i srin por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa tshangs pa'i srin por 'gyur ro //
translated: and the giving of Dharma by those who are overcome by envy and stinginess—when those who engage in such actions separate from their bodies, they will fall into the lower realms and be born in the world of starving spirits as a brahmin rākṣasa.

original: de ltar de mi'i gzugs kyis yongs su rgyug cing sems can rnams la nye bar 'tshe bar byed de /
analyzed: de ltar de mi'i gzugs kyis yongs su rgyug cing sems can rnams la nye bar 'tshe bar byed de /
translated: “In this way, they will roam around in human form, harming beings.

original: de sum mdo'am bzhi mdo dben par 'dug go /
analyzed: de sum mdo'am bzhi mdo dben par 'dug go /
translated: They will stay in empty places, such as crossroads and intersections.

original: 'dug nas kyang glags lta ba de mi rnams la nye bar 'tshe bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dug nas kyang glags lta ba de mi rnams la nye bar 'tshe bar byed do //
translated: While staying there, they will look for an opportunity to harm humans.

original: phal cher bram ze 'dra bar 'gyur la de nas mi snang bar 'gyur zhing yang mi rnams la nye bar 'tshe bar byed do //
analyzed: phal cher bram ze 'dra bar 'gyur la de nas mi snang bar 'gyur zhing yang mi rnams la nye bar 'tshe bar byed do //
translated: For the most part, they will become like Brahmins, and then they will disappear and again harm humans.

original: yi dvags la sems pa dag na re /
analyzed: yi dvags la sems pa dag na re /
translated: Those who think about ghosts say:

original: 'di ltar de ni gdon gyi zin to zhes 'jig rten pa de dag brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni gdon gyi zin to zhes 'jig rten pa de dag brjod do //
translated: ‘In this way, he is seized by an evil spirit.’

original: de ltar de sdig pa dang 'brel zhing sdig byed la lus bkres pa dang / skom pas gdungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar de sdig pa dang 'brel zhing sdig byed la lus bkres pa dang / skom pas gdungs pa yin te /
translated: Thus, they are related to evil, they do evil, and their bodies are tormented by hunger and thirst.

original: de ltar tshangs pa'i srin po de ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las byas shing bsags pa phrag dog dang / ser sna dang yang dag par ldan pa bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du yi dvags kyi yul de na gnas par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar tshangs pa'i srin po de ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las byas shing bsags pa phrag dog dang / ser sna dang yang dag par ldan pa bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du yi dvags kyi yul de na gnas par byed do //
translated: In this way, the Brahma-rākṣasa lives in that ghost realm for as long as those evil actions that were done and accumulated are destroyed, eliminated, and exhausted.

original: de phyis yi dvags kyi 'jig rten de las thar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de phyis yi dvags kyi 'jig rten de las thar bar 'gyur te /
translated: When he later escapes from that ghost realm,

original: thar nas kyang gal te lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis mir skyes na /
analyzed: thar nas kyang gal te lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis mir skyes na /
translated: if he is born with the general lot in life of a human due to karmic actions to be experienced in other lives,

original: las de dang rgyu mthun par mi la za ba'am /
analyzed: las de dang rgyu mthun par mi la za ba'am /
translated: In accordance with their causal actions, they will be born as humans who eat human flesh,

original: de mkha' 'gro ma mi'i khrag 'thung bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: de mkha' 'gro ma mi'i khrag 'thung bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
translated: or as ḍākinīs who drink human blood.

original: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des yi dvags kyi 'jig rten la brtags na /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des yi dvags kyi 'jig rten la brtags na /
translated: “Next, the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will examine the world of starving spirits.

original: des thos pa las byung @496b ba'i shes pas yi dvags kyi yul na yi dvags me'i khung bur za ba zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //🔽de las gang gis der skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung @496b ba'i shes pas yi dvags kyi yul na yi dvags me'i khung bur za ba zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo // de las gang gis der skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will then see that the realm of starving spirits includes what are called the starving spirits that eat from fire pits.

original: phrag dog dang / ser snas nyams pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen lta bur bcos nas dge 'dun gyi zas skom zos na /
analyzed: phrag dog dang / ser snas nyams pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen lta bur bcos nas dge 'dun gyi zas skom zos na /
translated: Inquiring into what type of karmic action may cause one to be born in that way, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing and thus perceive how some people, who are overcome by jealousy and stinginess, pretend to be spiritual teachers and eat the food and drink of the saṅgha.

original: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When they later separate from their bodies, they will fall into the lower realms, taking birth in the hell known as Fire Pit Eater.

original: de nas shi nas yi dvags me'i khung bur za ba rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas shi nas yi dvags me'i khung bur za ba rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //

translated: in the solitary places that are cold, windy, narrow, and very frightening, in the places without trees with hanging branches, in the places with only bad rocks, and in the places where lions and tigers kill and are very frightening.

analyzed: der skyes nas kyang grang ba'i dus su grang ba brgya 'gyur myong bar 'gyur la /

analyzed: lus bkres pa dang / skom pas gdungs pa dag la dug gi reg pa lcags kyi thu lum rab tu 'bar ba lta bu gang yin pa de dag mid @501b par byed do //

analyzed: mid ma thag tu shi'o //

analyzed: de nas yang nyes par byas pa'i las des skye bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: skyes nas kyang bkres pa dang / skom pa de sdug bsngal nyis 'gyur bas lhag par myong bar 'gyur ro; ;de ltar de du skad 'byin pa na /

analyzed: bya'i mchu rnon pos kyang de'i mig phyung nas za bar byed de /

analyzed: de phyir zhing sdug bsngal gyis nyam thag nas du skad 'byin / ku co 'don /

original: cho nges 'debs so //
analyzed: cho nges 'debs so //

analyzed: mig phyung ba de dag skye bar 'gyur la de nas yang 'byin par byed de /

original: de ltar ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las byas shing bsags pa so so yang dag par myong bar 'gyur ba bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las byas shing bsags pa so so yang dag par myong bar 'gyur ba bcom zhing spangs la zad par ma byas pa de srid du sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Until their karmic actions that were accumulated and performed are exhausted, they will continue to experience suffering.

original: de phyis yi dvags kyi 'jig rten de las thar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de phyis yi dvags kyi 'jig rten de las thar bar 'gyur te /
translated: “When they finally escape the world of starving spirits,

analyzed: thar nas kyang gal te lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis mir skyes na /

analyzed: las de dang rgyu mthun par de lam po che dang // bzhi mdor 'tsho bar 'gyur /

analyzed: dug ldud ldud pa'i las kyi lhag ma des yang de'i srog chad par 'gyur ba mthong ngo //

analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des yi dvags kyi 'jig rten la brtags na /

analyzed: de las gang gis der skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas @502a *//
translated: Wondering what karmic actions may cause beings to take birth there, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing.

translated: Thinking, ‘Here, we will kill these travelers who have come to us, who are thirsty and weak, for the sake of their wealth,’ they, with their minds impaired by envy and stinginess, and bereft of generosity, kill those travelers.

analyzed: shin tu mi bzad yi dvags yul; ;sdig las gal te bdag grol na // yang dang yang du sdig pa'i las //

analyzed: de ltar yi dvags smre sngags 'don pa de dag ji srad du de'i sdig pa'i las byas shing bsags pa so so yang dag par myong bar 'gyur ba bcom zhing spang la zad par ma byas pa de srid du der sdug bsngal chen po des gnod cing yid

analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas yi dvags kyi yul na yi dvags shing gi nang na gnas pa zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
translated: Inquiring further into the realms of hungry ghosts, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing and thus perceive the hungry ghosts that live in trees.

translated: Wondering what karmic actions may cause beings to take birth in that way, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing and thus perceive how some people, out of stinginess, will destroy a tree that provides for the Saṅgha or

analyzed: de bzhin du skye bo bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / lus ngal ba kun gyi 'tsho ba'i don du rdzing bu dang / khron pa byas pa de dag ser snas nyams pa de ma rung bar byas sam /

analyzed: shing skam 'dod pa'i phyir 'di ltar 'di dag ni bdag gi shing bya'o snyam nas gcod par byed cing de de bzhin du byed na /

analyzed: lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba yi dvags shing gi nang na 'dug par 'gyur ro //

translated: And when they are born there, the karma of those beings causes them to be born in the midst of trees that are extremely cold and sharp, just as when insects are born in the midst of dry wood and are harmed by the wood.

translated: Those who are tormented by suffering, if they should happen to be relieved of that suffering, will be eaten by the insects marīcika and aśokatarā, which live in the dry wood. They will be their food.

analyzed: gang kha cig gis bsams nas gtor ma gtor na des de'i srog 'tsho bar @506a *//

analyzed: byed de / yi dvags kyi yul de na ji srid du de'i sdig pa'i las byas shing bsags pa so so yang dag par myong bar 'gyur ba bcom zhing spangs la nyams par ma byas pa de srid du sdug bsngal rab tu mi bzad pa de myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that realm of hungry ghosts, for as long as the nonvirtuous karma that they created and accumulated is not destroyed, relinquished, and exhausted, for that long they will experience extremely terrible suffering.

original: des phyis yi dvags kyi yul de las thar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des phyis yi dvags kyi yul de las thar bar 'gyur te /
translated: Later, they will escape that realm of starving spirits.

analyzed: thar nas kyang gal te lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mir skyes na /
translated: If, due to karmic actions to be experienced in other lives, they should be born with the general lot in life of a human,

analyzed: las de dang rgyu mthun par de tshal dang / rtsva dang / sman dang / nags khrod dang / shing skam dang / me tog gis srog 'tsho ste /
translated: in accordance with their causal actions they will live in forests, on grasses, herbs, and trees, and on dry wood and flowers.

analyzed: 'tsho ba gzhan la rag las shing shin tu sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo //

original: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin ba shes pa des yi dvags kyi 'jig rten la brtags na /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin ba shes pa des yi dvags kyi 'jig rten la brtags na /

translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will notice how the world of starving spirits includes what are called the starving spirits that live at crossroads.

analyzed: de las gang gis der skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /

translated: When he investigates with knowledge derived from hearing, he will see that a thief who has the intention to harm others and who, out of stinginess, withholds food and drink from travelers, will, due to the power of that karma, be born as a hungry ghost living in a crossroads.

analyzed: pha rol gyi yid gcugs pa bcom pa'i las de'i mthus sog le dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: de dag gis nyin gcig bzhin du de'i lus bkres pa dang / skom pas gdungs pa de rnam pa bzhir gcod par byed / gsheg par byed /

analyzed: gang gi tshe skye bo dag 'jig par 'gyur ba de'i tshe byis pa phal pa byis pa'i rang bzhin can las dang / 'bras bu mngon par mi shes shing 'bras bu dang / rgyu ngan pa la lta ba de dag de'i tshe lam gyi bzhi mdor gtor ma 'thor bar byed de /

analyzed: 'di ltar 'dis nad pa'i nad rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro snyam nas gtor ma de lam gyi bzhi mdo de dag tu 'thor bar byed do //

analyzed: de des dga' bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: des srog 'tsho bar 'gyur zhing des gnas par 'gyur la des so sor ston par byed de /

translated: For as long as that nonvirtuous karma that they have created and accumulated is not destroyed, abandoned, and exhausted, for that long they remain in that realm of hungry ghosts.

analyzed: de phyis yi dvags kyi 'jig rten de las thar bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: thar nas kyang gal te lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las dang / mi rnams dang / skal ba mnyam par so so yang dag par myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis mir skyes @507a *//

analyzed: na las de dang / rgyu mthun par de rigs ngan pa phyugs gsod pa byed par 'gyur ba mthong ngo //

analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des yi dvags kyi 'jig rten la brtags na /
translated: “Next, the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will examine the world of starving spirits.

translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will then notice how the realm of starving spirits contains what are called the demonic spirits. Wondering what karmic actions may cause one to be born in that way, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing.

original: las ngan pas 'tsho ba /
analyzed: las ngan pas 'tsho ba /
translated: He will then notice how some people make a living through evil actions.

analyzed: g-yos gzhan la gnod par byed pa //

analyzed: rgyu ngan pa dang / lta ba ngan pa'i mtha' la de nyid yin no bar mngon par zhen pa gang gis lam bzang po sun par byas na /
translated: “Those who, due to bad causes and bad views, have reviled the good path,

analyzed: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba yi dvags bdud kyi ris rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: will, when separating from their bodies, fall into the lower realms and be born among the hungry ghosts in the realm of the māras.

analyzed: der skyes nas kyang rtag tu dge slong bsam gtan gyi zas kyis gnas pa rnams kyi sems rnyog pa can du byed /

original: rnam par 'tshe bar byed /
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe bar byed /
translated: They will harm them,

original: sgra bo che 'don par byed /
analyzed: sgra bo che 'don par byed /

original: de rmi lam du bgegs dag byed de /
analyzed: de rmi lam du bgegs dag byed de /

analyzed: dam pa'i chos la sdang ba ni bdud kyi dbang du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who hate the sublime Dharma will fall under the power of the māras.

original: de ltar yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lam du zhugs pa de ni tshe 'di la myong bar 'gyur ba yi dvags kyi yul du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lam du zhugs pa de ni tshe 'di la myong bar 'gyur ba yi dvags kyi yul du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: “Thus, those who have entered the wrong path will, in this life, experience the results of their actions and be born in the realm of the hungry ghosts.

original: kha zas ni lcags kyi thu lum za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha zas ni lcags kyi thu lum za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Their food will be lumps of iron.

original: de de dag gis sreg @507b cing shin tu sdug bsngal ba myong ba na /
analyzed: de de dag gis sreg @507b cing shin tu sdug bsngal ba myong ba na /
translated: They are burned and experience extreme suffering.

original: shin tu sdug bsngal ba de las skyo bar mi byed de /
analyzed: shin tu sdug bsngal ba de las skyo bar mi byed de /
translated: They do not become disenchanted with that extreme suffering.

original: de de nas shi nas sems can dmyal ba'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de de nas shi nas sems can dmyal ba'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When they die, they are born in the hells.

original: de nas bskal pa mang po zhig gis mi lus thob par 'gyur te /🔽gal te bskal pa khri 'am /
analyzed: de nas bskal pa mang po zhig gis mi lus thob par 'gyur te / gal te bskal pa khri 'am /
translated: After many eons, they obtain a human birth.🔽If they obtain it after ten thousand eons,

original: gal te bskal pa nyi khris 'thob la /
analyzed: gal te bskal pa nyi khris 'thob la /
translated: or if they obtain it after twenty thousand eons,

original: de ltar nges par ngan song gsum rnams su 'tshed do //
analyzed: de ltar nges par ngan song gsum rnams su 'tshed do //
translated: they will definitely be boiled, burned, and eaten in the three lower realms.

original: sreg go / za'o; ;gal te'ang de nas lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis gnya' shing gi bu gar rus sbal 'jug pa lta bur mi rnams dang bskal pa mnyam par mir skyes na; las da dang rgyu mthun par de long ba dang /
analyzed: sreg go / za'o; ;gal te'ang de nas lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis gnya' shing gi bu gar rus sbal 'jug pa lta bur mi rnams dang bskal pa mnyam par mir skyes na; las da dang rgyu mthun par de long ba dang /
translated: If, due to karma to be experienced in a next life, they are born as a human being, as rare as a turtle putting its neck through the hole of a yoke, in accordance with their causal actions, they will be blind,

analyzed: 'on pa dang / lkugs pa dang / dran pa nyams pa dang / nad du mas lus nyams pa dang / shin tu dbul bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
translated: They will be born deaf, mute, and mentally impaired, their bodies will be ravaged by many diseases, and they will be extremely poor.

original: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des yi dvags kyi 'jig rten la brtags na /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des yi dvags kyi 'jig rten la brtags na /
translated: “Next, the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will examine the world of starving spirits.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas 'di ltar yi dvags kyi 'jig rten las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa'i bye brag gis yi dvags kyi 'gro ba rags pa de tsam dag ni mthong na 'khor 'bum phrag du ma ni ma mthong ste /

translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will then notice that the world of starving spirits is divided into different types of karmic ripening. He will see that the world of starving spirits is vast, but he will not see the many hundreds of thousands of its surrounding areas.

original: gang rgya mtsho'i mtha'i bar rnams dang / gang rgya mtsho'i gling rnams dang / gang dzambu'i gling rnams dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa dang / shar gyi lus 'phags dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan la sogs pa'i @508a *//
analyzed: gang rgya mtsho'i mtha'i bar rnams dang / gang rgya mtsho'i gling rnams dang / gang dzambu'i gling rnams dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa dang / shar gyi lus 'phags dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan la sogs pa'i @508a *//
translated: He will see the regions that lie beyond the oceans, the islands in the oceans, the regions of Jambudvīpa, Godānīya in the west, Videha in the east, and Kuru in the north.

original: gling chen po rnams kyi bar na gnas pa de dag gi ming gi rnam grangs tsam shes so //
analyzed: gling chen po rnams kyi bar na gnas pa de dag gi ming gi rnam grangs tsam shes so //
translated: One can know only the names of the places that are located between the continents.

original: srin po dang / sha za dang / grul bum de dag gi las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa dag ni shin tu phra bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: srin po dang / sha za dang / grul bum de dag gi las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa dag ni shin tu phra bar shes par bya ste /
translated: The results of the actions of the rākṣasas, piśācas, and kumbhāṇḍas are very subtle.

original: gang las gang gis der skyes /
analyzed: gang las gang gis der skyes /
translated: From what actions are they born there?

original: kha zas ni ci za /
analyzed: kha zas ni ci za /
translated: What do they eat?

original: spyod pa ni ci yin /
analyzed: spyod pa ni ci yin /
translated: What is their behavior?

original: rgyu ni ci zhig yin snyam mo //
analyzed: rgyu ni ci zhig yin snyam mo //
translated: What are their causes?

original: de dag gi gnas na sems ni spre'u ltar sdom pa med par rnam par g-yo la /
analyzed: de dag gi gnas na sems ni spre'u ltar sdom pa med par rnam par g-yo la /
translated: Their minds are like monkeys, moving without restraint.🔽They run about like banana trees in a great wind.

original: ba lang gi rna ba 'gul zhing ldog ba chu shing tshal du zhugs na rna ba shin tu 'gul ba ltar ni rab tu rgyug /🔽bum pa rdol ba ltar yul thams cad la ni khyab /
analyzed: ba lang gi rna ba 'gul zhing ldog ba chu shing tshal du zhugs na rna ba shin tu 'gul ba ltar ni rab tu rgyug / bum pa rdol ba ltar yul thams cad la ni khyab /
translated: They spread out like broken pots.

original: rlung chen pos rdul bslang ba ltar shin tu g-yo bar ni byed /
analyzed: rlung chen pos rdul bslang ba ltar shin tu g-yo bar ni byed /
translated: They move like dust blown by a great wind.

original: seng ge dang / stag dang / sbrul gdug pa dag pas kyang shin tu gdul ni dka'/
analyzed: seng ge dang / stag dang / sbrul gdug pa dag pas kyang shin tu gdul ni dka'/
translated: They are difficult to control even more than lions, tigers, and poisonous snakes.

original: gang g-yos pa ni de'i pha rol tu 'bras bu de dang mthun par thob ste /🔽sems can rnams kyi sems kun nas nyon mongs pa las ni kun nas nyon mongs la /
analyzed: gang g-yos pa ni de'i pha rol tu 'bras bu de dang mthun par thob ste / sems can rnams kyi sems kun nas nyon mongs pa las ni kun nas nyon mongs la /
translated: Whatever it moves toward, it obtains a result in accordance with that.🔽From a mind that is thoroughly afflicted, there is thorough affliction.

original: sems rnam par byang ba las ni rnam par grol bar 'gyur te shes par dka'o //
analyzed: sems rnam par byang ba las ni rnam par grol bar 'gyur te shes par dka'o //
translated: From a mind that is completely purified, there is complete purification.

original: sems ni rgyal po 'dra la /
analyzed: sems ni rgyal po 'dra la /
translated: The mind is like a king.

original: dbang po rnams ni zhabs 'bring ba lta bu yin te /🔽de la rag las pa ni las yin la /
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni zhabs 'bring ba lta bu yin te / de la rag las pa ni las yin la /
translated: The faculties are like servants.🔽Karma depends on it.

original: las la rag las pa ni 'bras bu yin /
analyzed: las la rag las pa ni 'bras bu yin /
translated: Results depend on karma.

original: 'bras bu la rag las pa ni 'gro ba lnga dag yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu la rag las pa ni 'gro ba lnga dag yin no //
translated: The five types of transmigration depend on results.

original: sems 'khrul 'khor mkhan 'dra zhing lus ni 'khrul 'khor 'dral /
analyzed: sems 'khrul 'khor mkhan 'dra zhing lus ni 'khrul 'khor 'dral /
translated: The mind is like the engineer of a machine. The body is like the machine.

original: dbang po rnams dang / dbang po'i don @508b ni skud pa 'dra ste /
analyzed: dbang po rnams dang / dbang po'i don @508b ni skud pa 'dra ste /
translated: The faculties and the objects of the faculties are like the strings.

original: sems ma dul ba de ni ngan song du 'gro la /
analyzed: sems ma dul ba de ni ngan song du 'gro la /
translated: An undisciplined mind goes to the lower realms.

original: shin tu dul zhing legs par yongs su sbyang ba byas pa ni lha dang / mi'i 'gro bar 'gro ba dang / g-yo ba med pa'i gnas mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gro'o snyam ste /
analyzed: shin tu dul zhing legs par yongs su sbyang ba byas pa ni lha dang / mi'i 'gro bar 'gro ba dang / g-yo ba med pa'i gnas mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gro'o snyam ste /
translated: “ ‘Those who are very disciplined and well trained will go to the realms of gods and humans, and they will go to the state of nirvāṇa, which is free of movement.’

original: de ltar dge slong de sems kyi rnam pa shin tu phra ba la rnam par spyod do //
analyzed: de ltar dge slong de sems kyi rnam pa shin tu phra ba la rnam par spyod do //
translated: “Thus, the monk will analyze the most subtle aspects of the mind.

original: rnam par dpyad nas 'khor ba rnams la shin tu skyo ba skyes te /
analyzed: rnam par dpyad nas 'khor ba rnams la shin tu skyo ba skyes te /
translated: Having analyzed them, he will become disenchanted with cyclic existence.

original: sems can dmyal ba 'khor dang bcas pa dag la skye la /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba 'khor dang bcas pa dag la skye la /
translated: He will then be born in the hells and their surrounding areas.

original: de ltar yang yi dvags kyi 'jig rten dag la lhag par shin tu skyo ste /
analyzed: de ltar yang yi dvags kyi 'jig rten dag la lhag par shin tu skyo ste /
translated: In the same way, he will become disenchanted with the world of the pretas.

original: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa rtogs /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa rtogs /
translated: He will realize the noble truth of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i lam rtogs shing lam bzang po dang / lam la gnas pa rtogs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i lam rtogs shing lam bzang po dang / lam la gnas pa rtogs so //
translated: He will realize the noble truth of the path, and he will realize the good path and those who abide on the path.🔽”

original: yi dvags kyi le'u ste gnyis pa rdzogs so ////
analyzed: yi dvags kyi le'u ste gnyis pa rdzogs so ////
translated: This concludes the second chapter.

original: de nas yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa 'di ltar dge slong las kyi 'bras bu'i de kho na nyid mthong ba des sems can dmyal ba 'khor dang bcas pa rnams la brtags shing 'gro ba gnyis pa la'ang
analyzed: de nas yang rnal 'byor spyod pa nang gi chos la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa 'di ltar dge slong las kyi 'bras bu'i de kho na nyid mthong ba des sems can dmyal ba 'khor dang bcas pa rnams la brtags shing 'gro ba gnyis pa la'ang
translated: “The spiritual practitioner who carefully considers and attends to the internal phenomena of the inner principles will then, as a monk who sees the reality of karmic actions, examine the hells and their surrounding areas.

original: brtags na 'khor ba mi zad pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong ste yid la'ang 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: brtags na 'khor ba mi zad pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong ste yid la'ang 'jog par byed do //
translated: When he examines the second realm, he will see the impermanence of cyclic existence as it truly is, and he will keep it in mind.

original: 'di ltar dge slong de bdud kyi yul na mi gnas shing /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge slong de bdud kyi yul na mi gnas shing /
translated: In this way, the monk will not remain within the domain of the māras.

original: de mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha' la gnas la de'i spro ba mi ldog ste /
analyzed: de mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha' la gnas la de'i spro ba mi ldog ste /
translated: He will abide by the limit of transcendence of suffering, and his enthusiasm will not be reversed.

original: 'bras bur gyur pas gzhan bco lnga pa la zhugs so //🔽de zhugs pa dang sa bla'i gnod sbyin dag dga' @509a *//
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pas gzhan bco lnga pa la zhugs so // de zhugs pa dang sa bla'i gnod sbyin dag dga' @509a *//
translated: Since he has attained the result, he will enter the fifteenth state.

original: nas bar snang la rgyu ba'i gnod sbyin rnams la bsnyad do //
analyzed: nas bar snang la rgyu ba'i gnod sbyin rnams la bsnyad do //
translated: “When he has entered that state, the terrestrial yakṣas will be delighted and inform the celestial yakṣas.

original: de dag gis kyang rgyal chen bzhi rnams la'o //
analyzed: de dag gis kyang rgyal chen bzhi rnams la'o //
translated: They, in turn, will inform the Four Great Kings.

original: de dag gis kyang sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams la'o; ;sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams kyis kyang 'thab bral ba rnams la'o //🔽'thab bral ba rnams kyis kyang dga' ldan pa rnams la'o //🔽dga' ldan pa rnams kyis kyang 'phrul dga' ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: de dag gis kyang sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams la'o; ;sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams kyis kyang 'thab bral ba rnams la'o // 'thab bral ba rnams kyis kyang dga' ldan pa rnams la'o // dga' ldan pa rnams kyis kyang 'phrul dga' ba rnams la'o //
translated: The Yāma gods also hear the sounds of the Tuṣita gods.🔽The Tuṣita gods also hear the sounds of the Nirmāṇarati gods.

original: 'phrul dga' ba rnams kyis kyang gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: 'phrul dga' ba rnams kyis kyang gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams la'o //
translated: The Nirmāṇarati gods also hear the sounds of the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods.

original: de ltar 'dod pa'i khams kyi sgra dag gzugs kyi khams su'ang grag pa nas tshangs ris la sogs pa'i bar dag dang / 'od gsal gyi bar rnams su sgra grag ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa'i khams kyi sgra dag gzugs kyi khams su'ang grag pa nas tshangs ris la sogs pa'i bar dag dang / 'od gsal gyi bar rnams su sgra grag ste /
translated: In this way, the sounds of the desire realm are heard up to the form realm, up to the Brahmakāyika gods and up to the Ābhāsvara gods.🔽Thus it is said:

original: 'di ltar / kye lha dag /
analyzed: 'di ltar / kye lha dag /
translated: “O gods!

original: dzambu'i gling du rigs kyi bu che ge mo zhig dang / grong mang ge mo zhig dang / grong khyer ga ge mo zhig dang / grong rdal che ge mo zhig dang / yul mang ge mo zhig na ming ga ge mo zhig ces bya ba skra dang kha spu bregs nas gos dur smrig bgo sa te dad pas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung ngo //
analyzed: dzambu'i gling du rigs kyi bu che ge mo zhig dang / grong mang ge mo zhig dang / grong khyer ga ge mo zhig dang / grong rdal che ge mo zhig dang / yul mang ge mo zhig na ming ga ge mo zhig ces bya ba skra dang kha spu bregs nas gos dur smrig bgo sa te dad pas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung ngo //
translated: In Jambudvīpa, a son of noble family named so-and-so, from such-and-such a village, such-and-such a town, such-and-such a city, such-and-such a district, such-and-such a country, with such-and-such a name, has shaved off his hair and beard, put on the orange robes, and with faith gone forth from the household to the houseless life.

original: de bdud kyi gzhi dang lhan cig gnas par mi 'dod la de'i yul gyi dngos po'ang mi 'dod /🔽bdud kyi sde ni 'joms par byed /
analyzed: de bdud kyi gzhi dang lhan cig gnas par mi 'dod la de'i yul gyi dngos po'ang mi 'dod / bdud kyi sde ni 'joms par byed /
translated: He does not wish to dwell together with the bases of Māra, nor does he wish for the things of Māra’s domain.🔽He conquers Māra’s army.

original: bdud kyi g-yog ni 'jig par byed /
analyzed: bdud kyi g-yog ni 'jig par byed /
translated: He destroys Māra’s retinue.

original: nyon mongs pa'i ri ni shin tu g-yo bar byed /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i ri ni shin tu g-yo bar byed /
translated: He shakes the mountain of afflictions.

original: dam pa'i chos kyi lam du ni 'jug par byed /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi lam du ni 'jug par byed /
translated: He enters the path of the sublime Dharma.

original: de'i 'od @509b ni rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i 'od @509b ni rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: His light shines forth.

original: de ltar sa gzhan bco lnga pa la zhugs so //
analyzed: de ltar sa gzhan bco lnga pa la zhugs so //
translated: Thus he enters the fifteenth ground.

original: de thos nas 'od gsal gyi lha rnams dga' ste /
analyzed: de thos nas 'od gsal gyi lha rnams dga' ste /
translated: When they hear this, the gods of the Heaven of Pure Abodes rejoice.

original: lha gzhan dag la smras pa /
analyzed: lha gzhan dag la smras pa /
translated: He said to the other gods,

original: 'di ltar / kye lha dag /
analyzed: 'di ltar / kye lha dag /
translated: “O gods,

original: bdag cag ni mchog tu dga' ste /
analyzed: bdag cag ni mchog tu dga' ste /
translated: we are extremely happy.

original: gang bdud kyi phyogs ni dma'o //
analyzed: gang bdud kyi phyogs ni dma'o //
translated: The side of the māras has been humbled.

original: dam pa'i chos kyi phyogs ni mngon par mtho'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi phyogs ni mngon par mtho'o //
translated: The side of the Dharma has been exalted.

original: bdud kyi 'khor ni yongs su nyams so //
analyzed: bdud kyi 'khor ni yongs su nyams so //
translated: The retinue of the māras has been destroyed.

original: dam pa'i chos kyi chu bo ni rab tu 'bab bo //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi chu bo ni rab tu 'bab bo //
translated: The river of the Dharma has been flowing.

original: mu stegs kyi mtsho ni rnam par skems so //
analyzed: mu stegs kyi mtsho ni rnam par skems so //
translated: The lake of the tīrthikas has been dried up.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams ni rab tu rtse zhil lo //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams ni rab tu rtse zhil lo //
translated: Desire, anger, and ignorance have been extinguished.

original: chos ma yin pa'i phyogs ni zhig go /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa'i phyogs ni zhig go /
translated: The side of non-Dharma has been destroyed.

original: dam pa'i chos kyi phyogs ni rab tu 'phel lo //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi phyogs ni rab tu 'phel lo //
translated: The side of the Dharma has been exalted.

original: 'khor ba ni 'jig ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba ni 'jig ste /
translated: Saṃsāra has been destroyed.

original: kye de dag bdag cag gis thos nas mchog tu dga'o //
analyzed: kye de dag bdag cag gis thos nas mchog tu dga'o //
translated: O, we have heard that and are extremely happy.”

original: de ltar dam pa'i chos kyi sgra 'od gsal gyi lha'i ris kyi bar du gcig nas gcig tu grag ste /
analyzed: de ltar dam pa'i chos kyi sgra 'od gsal gyi lha'i ris kyi bar du gcig nas gcig tu grag ste /
translated: In this way, the sound of the Dharma spread from one realm of the gods to the next, up to the gods of the Clear Light realm.

original: dge slong de brtson 'grus ni brtsams /
analyzed: dge slong de brtson 'grus ni brtsams /
translated: “The monk has begun to practice diligence.

original: sems ni dge zhing mi g-yo la brtan /
analyzed: sems ni dge zhing mi g-yo la brtan /
translated: His mind is virtuous, unwavering, and stable.

original: g-yo med cing drang po'i rang bzhin can yin te; de ltar de'i dge ba'i sgra mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer gyi sngon du 'dren par brag go /
analyzed: g-yo med cing drang po'i rang bzhin can yin te; de ltar de'i dge ba'i sgra mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer gyi sngon du 'dren par brag go /
translated: He is honest and upright, and thus his virtuous sound is like a mountain that leads to the city of the transcendence of suffering.

original: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sems can dmyal ba'i las kyi chos kyi rnam par smin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing sems can dmyal ba rnams kyi 'khor brgya sum cu rtsa drug gi tshe
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des sems can dmyal ba'i las kyi chos kyi rnam par smin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes shing sems can dmyal ba rnams kyi 'khor brgya sum cu rtsa drug gi tshe
translated: “As the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects understands the ripening of karmic phenomena in the hells, he will also understand the lifespans of the beings in the thirty-six hells.

original: ring ba dang / tshe'i lhag pa'i @510a *//
analyzed: ring ba dang / tshe'i lhag pa'i @510a *//
translated: He will understand the lifespans of the beings in the hells and their remaining lifespans.

original: tshad dang bcas pa de'ang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes nas 'gro ba gnyis pa la'ang rtog par byed de /
analyzed: tshad dang bcas pa de'ang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes nas 'gro ba gnyis pa la'ang rtog par byed de /
translated: “With such knowledge, he will also contemplate the second realm,

original: yi dvags rnam pa yod pa yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug yod pa la rtog par byed do //
analyzed: yi dvags rnam pa yod pa yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug yod pa la rtog par byed do //
translated: the realm of starving spirits. In brief, he will contemplate the thirty-six types of starving spirits.

original: rim par 'khod pa'i de dag gi de kho na nyid la rtog ste /
analyzed: rim par 'khod pa'i de dag gi de kho na nyid la rtog ste /
translated: He will contemplate the reality of the starving spirits in the following order.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas dud 'gro'i rnam pa bye ba sum cu rtsa bzhi mthong nas /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas dud 'gro'i rnam pa bye ba sum cu rtsa bzhi mthong nas /
translated: As he applies insight derived from hearing, he sees thirty-four types of animal births.

original: 'di ltar 'gro ba lnga dag ni sems kyi kha na las shing rag lus pa yin la phal cher kun kyang cha byad dang / gzugs dang / 'gro ba dang / kha zas sna tshogs 'chang ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gro ba lnga dag ni sems kyi kha na las shing rag lus pa yin la phal cher kun kyang cha byad dang / gzugs dang / 'gro ba dang / kha zas sna tshogs 'chang ba /
translated: “The five types of migrations are the result of mental actions and are subject to karmic ripening. Most of them are characterized by various forms, shapes, movements, and foods.

original: mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa dang / sdang ba dang / mi sdang ba dang / bshes pa dang / mi bshes pa dang / lhan cig spyod pa dang / lhan cig mi spyod pa'i rigs can dag yin no //
analyzed: mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa dang / sdang ba dang / mi sdang ba dang / bshes pa dang / mi bshes pa dang / lhan cig spyod pa dang / lhan cig mi spyod pa'i rigs can dag yin no //
translated: They are of the type that is either compatible or incompatible, hostile or friendly, intimate or distant, and social or solitary.

original: de dag gi nang nas 'dab ma yod par gyur pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag gi nang nas 'dab ma yod par gyur pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among them, those that have wings are

original: rigs kyi tshogs dang / bya'i tshogs bya rog dang / dang pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: rigs kyi tshogs dang / bya'i tshogs bya rog dang / dang pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: the flocks of birds, such as crows, parrots, and so forth.

original: mthun ba dang / mi mthun par gyur pa dag ni 'di ltar wa dang / khyi lta bu ste de la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mthun ba dang / mi mthun par gyur pa dag ni 'di ltar wa dang / khyi lta bu ste de la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those that are compatible or incompatible are, for example, foxes and dogs.

original: sdang ba dang / mi sdang ba dag ni /
analyzed: sdang ba dang / mi sdang ba dag ni /
translated: Those that are hostile or friendly are

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are like

original: bya rog dang / 'ug pa dang / rta dang / ma he dang; sbrul dang / ne'u le la sogs pa lta bu dag go /🔽de la srog chags dag las gang gis cha byad dang / gzugs dang / 'gro ba dang / kha zas sna tshogs su 'gyur snyam nas @510b des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: bya rog dang / 'ug pa dang / rta dang / ma he dang; sbrul dang / ne'u le la sogs pa lta bu dag go / de la srog chags dag las gang gis cha byad dang / gzugs dang / 'gro ba dang / kha zas sna tshogs su 'gyur snyam nas @510b des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: crows, owls, horses, buffaloes, snakes, and mongooses.🔽“What causes the various appearances, forms, behaviors, and foods of these beings?”

original: 'di ltar srog chags dag sems sna tshogs dang / srog chags dag rag las pa dang / las rnam pa sna tshogs byed de /🔽de dag gi 'gro ba rnam pa sna tshogs su 'gyur zhing kha zas rnam pa sna tshogs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar srog chags dag sems sna tshogs dang / srog chags dag rag las pa dang / las rnam pa sna tshogs byed de / de dag gi 'gro ba rnam pa sna tshogs su 'gyur zhing kha zas rnam pa sna tshogs su 'gyur ro //
translated: He will then understand that the various minds of beings and the various karmic actions they perform are the causes of their various appearances, forms, behaviors, and foods.🔽“What are the causes of their concordant and discordant behavior?”

original: de la gang mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa'i rgyu gang yin snyam nas de dag gi las la rnam par dpyod de /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: de la gang mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa'i rgyu gang yin snyam nas de dag gi las la rnam par dpyod de /🔽des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: He will then understand that the various karmic actions they perform are the causes of their concordant and discordant behavior.

original: mir gyur pa gang gis lta ba log pa'i bstan bcos brjod la mkhas pa nga rgyal can gnyis pas kyang bstan bcos ngan pa gnyis pa brjod na /
analyzed: mir gyur pa gang gis lta ba log pa'i bstan bcos brjod la mkhas pa nga rgyal can gnyis pas kyang bstan bcos ngan pa gnyis pa brjod na /
translated: “If two proud and learned people, who have become human, speak about bad treatises with wrong views,

original: de gnyis kyi thos pa de don med pa dang / bde ba ma yin pa dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi thos pa de don med pa dang / bde ba ma yin pa dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba ma yin te /
translated: then their learning will be meaningless, not conducive to happiness, and not conducive to a good rebirth.

original: bstan bcos ngan pa dang / rgyu ngan pa dang / lta ba ngan pa'i mtha' de gnyis kyis phan tshun dga' bar byed na /
analyzed: bstan bcos ngan pa dang / rgyu ngan pa dang / lta ba ngan pa'i mtha' de gnyis kyis phan tshun dga' bar byed na /
translated: If those two, through the two extremes of bad treatises, bad causes, and bad views, delight each other,

original: de gnyis shi nas sems can dmyal ba rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gnyis shi nas sems can dmyal ba rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then when they die they will be reborn among the hell beings.

analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des dud 'gro'i 'jig rten la rtog par byed de /
translated: Next, the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will examine the animal world.

original: zas gsum pa yid la sems pa zhes bya ba des sems can de dag ji ltar bdag nyid 'tsho bar byed snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: zas gsum pa yid la sems pa zhes bya ba des sems can de dag ji ltar bdag nyid 'tsho bar byed snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: “What is the third type of food, the one called ‘mental intention’? How do sentient beings sustain themselves through mental intention?”

original: 'di ltar sgo nga las skye ba nya dang / chu srin ma kar dang / kum bhi ra dang / na kra dang / nya phyis dang / dung la sogs pa'i sgo nga las skye ba skyes pa rnams yid la sems pa'i zas des 'tsho bar byed do //🔽gal te ma'am /

translated: With knowledge derived from hearing, he will then examine how beings who are born from eggs, such as fish, crocodiles, turtles, kum-bhiras, nakras, oysters, and conch shells, are sustained by the food of mental intention.

original: gal te phas rang gi bu dran na dran pa des tshim par byed de /
analyzed: gal te phas rang gi bu dran na dran pa des tshim par byed de /
translated: If the mother or the father remembers their child, that memory will satisfy them.

analyzed: de nas yang 'phel bar byed cing 'tsho bar byed la kha zas kyi bya ba'ang byed do //
translated: This will then increase and sustain them, and it will also serve as food.

original: de las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas dge slong de rab tu dpyod de /
analyzed: de las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas dge slong de rab tu dpyod de /

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /🔽blo zhan cing las dang 'bras bu dag mngon par mi shes pa gang gis gzhan dag la 'di ltar ngas khyod la zla ba phyed dam /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na / blo zhan cing las dang 'bras bu dag mngon par mi shes pa gang gis gzhan dag la 'di ltar ngas khyod la zla ba phyed dam /
translated: Investigating with knowledge derived from hearing, he will see that

analyzed: zla ba gcig na nor rdzas kyi rnam @514b pa'am /
translated: some people of little intelligence and no understanding of the karmic law of cause and effect promise others, “I will give you some wealth,🔽some food,

original: kha zas kyi rnam pa'am /🔽nor gyi dbyig gi rnam pa cung zad sbyin no zhes khas blangs la de'i tshig de dbul po des thos nas dga' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: kha zas kyi rnam pa'am / nor gyi dbyig gi rnam pa cung zad sbyin no zhes khas blangs la de'i tshig de dbul po des thos nas dga' bar 'gyur te /
translated: or some money.”🔽When the poor person hears those words, he will be delighted, thinking, “This benefactor has promised me, a poor person, that he will give me something.”

original: 'di ltar sbyin bdag 'dis bdag dbul po la khas blangs pa de bdag la sbyin par byed do snyam nas de yid mchog tu dga' nas de bzhin du zla ba phyed dam /
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyin bdag 'dis bdag dbul po la khas blangs pa de bdag la sbyin par byed do snyam nas de yid mchog tu dga' nas de bzhin du zla ba phyed dam /
translated: With the highest joy in his mind, he will wait for the promised time, whether it is half a month or a month.

original: zla ba gcig gi dus su de 'ongs nas de'i drung du phyin pa dang / mi ngan pa des kha stongs par byas na /
analyzed: zla ba gcig gi dus su de 'ongs nas de'i drung du phyin pa dang / mi ngan pa des kha stongs par byas na /
translated: When the time comes, he will go to the benefactor, but the bad person will have forgotten his promise.

original: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba dga' ba dang / dga' ba med pa'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba dga' ba dang / dga' ba med pa'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When they later separate from their bodies, they will fall into the lower realms, taking birth in the hell known as Joy and Absence of Joy.

original: de nas thar nas kyang gal te dud 'gro rnams kyi nang du skyes na 'di ltar des de la rdzun byas nas yid dga' bar byas pa de'i mthus de yid la sems pa'i zas 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas thar nas kyang gal te dud 'gro rnams kyi nang du skyes na 'di ltar des de la rdzun byas nas yid dga' bar byas pa de'i mthus de yid la sems pa'i zas 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they escape that hell, they may be born among the animals. In that case, they will obtain food that is mentally created, due to the power of having deceived others and made them happy.

original: gal te mi rnams kyi nang du skyes na las de dang rgyu mthun par de de'i bran nyid du 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: gal te mi rnams kyi nang du skyes na las de dang rgyu mthun par de de'i bran nyid du 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
translated: If they are born with the general lot in life of a human, they will, in accordance with their causal actions, become a slave.

original: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des dud 'gro'i 'jig rten kha zas bzhi pa dga' ba zhes bya ba la rtog par byed de /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des dud 'gro'i 'jig rten kha zas bzhi pa dga' ba zhes bya ba la rtog par byed de /
translated: “The monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will continue to examine the animal world, wondering about the fourth type of food, which is called joy.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas 'di ltar dud 'gro'i yul na dud 'gro ;kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi dga' ba'i zas kyis 'tsho ba yod de /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas 'di ltar dud 'gro'i yul na dud 'gro ;kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi dga' ba'i zas kyis 'tsho ba yod de /
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will then notice how in the animal realm there are animals that live on food that is joyful and afflicted.

original: nags khung na sbrul po che aa dza ga ra zhes pa dga' ba'i zas dang / rlung za zhing 'tsho ba dang / srog chags @515a *//
analyzed: nags khung na sbrul po che aa dza ga ra zhes pa dga' ba'i zas dang / rlung za zhing 'tsho ba dang / srog chags @515a *//
translated: In the forests there are large snakes called ājagara, which live on the food of joy and survive on wind.

original: ga la go li ka dang / ri zhol gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang gzhan yang yod de /
analyzed: ga la go li ka dang / ri zhol gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang gzhan yang yod de /
translated: There are also other animals such as the gāvalīka and the mountain-dweller.

original: de la 'od gsal gyi lha rnams kyi dga' ba'i zas ni gnod sems med pa'i dga' ba'i zas kyis 'tsho ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de la 'od gsal gyi lha rnams kyi dga' ba'i zas ni gnod sems med pa'i dga' ba'i zas kyis 'tsho ba yin gyi /
translated: The food of joy of the gods of the realm of luminosity is the food of joy of non-harm.

original: dud 'gro'i dga' ba'i zas ni 'khon gyi lha ba dang / 'khon dam du 'dzin pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin na /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i dga' ba'i zas ni 'khon gyi lha ba dang / 'khon dam du 'dzin pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin na /
translated: The food of joy of animals is the food of joy of holding grudges and the food of joy of holding grudges tightly.

original: de dag las gang gis der skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: de dag las gang gis der skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: Wondering what kind of karmic action may cause one to be born in that way, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing.🔽He will then notice, ‘Those who are of a very hateful nature

original: zhe sdang gi shas che ba'am /🔽zhe sdang gi rang bzhin can gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi shas che ba'am /🔽zhe sdang gi rang bzhin can gang yin pa ste /
translated: or who have a hateful character

original: 'khon gyi rgyu dang mthun pa dang / gti mug gis shas che ba des srog gcod par byas na de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khon gyi rgyu dang mthun pa dang / gti mug gis shas che ba des srog gcod par byas na de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “When the cause of such anger is present, and when the person is dominated by delusion, then, when the life of such a person comes to an end, he will fall into the lower realms and be born among the hell beings.

original: de 'khon dang dga' ba'i gzhi yod pa des dud 'gro rnams kyi nang du skyes na dga' ba'i zas dang rlung za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de 'khon dang dga' ba'i gzhi yod pa des dud 'gro rnams kyi nang du skyes na dga' ba'i zas dang rlung za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “If, due to the presence of the basis of anger and joy, he is born among the animals, he will be born as a bird that eats food that is enjoyed and that eats the wind.

original: de gal te mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mir skyes na /
analyzed: de gal te mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par mir skyes na /
translated: If, with the likelihood of a sea turtle poking its head through a yoke floating on the ocean, he should be born with the general lot in life of a human,

original: las de dang rgyu mthun par de rtag par glo bur du pha rol dang lhan cig rgyu med par 'thab pa dang 'brel par 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: las de dang rgyu mthun par de rtag par glo bur du pha rol dang lhan cig rgyu med par 'thab pa dang 'brel par 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
translated: in accordance with his causal actions he will always suddenly and without reason become involved in quarrels with others.

original: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des rnam pa gzhan gyis dud 'gro'i 'jig rten mtha' yas pa la rtog par byed de /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa des rnam pa gzhan gyis dud 'gro'i 'jig rten mtha' yas pa la rtog par byed de /
translated: “The monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will continue to examine the infinite animal world in other ways.

original: yang chu'i nang na rgyu ba dag @515b ji ltar skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: yang chu'i nang na rgyu ba dag @515b ji ltar skye bar 'gyur snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: “What kind of beings live in the water?” With insight derived from hearing, he will apply himself to the investigation of this matter.

original: gang blo zhan cing rnam par shes pa zhan pa skom gyis gdungs bzhin du 'chi ba'i dus byed na /
analyzed: gang blo zhan cing rnam par shes pa zhan pa skom gyis gdungs bzhin du 'chi ba'i dus byed na /
translated: He will then notice, ‘When a person of weak mind and weak consciousness dies of thirst,

original: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba chu'i nang na rgyu bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lus dang bral nas ngan 'gro log par ltung ba chu'i nang na rgyu bar 'gyur ro //
translated: after separating from the body, he will fall into the lower realms and be born among the water-dwelling beings.

original: de bzhin du nya'i skye gnas rnam pa sna tshogs kyi nang na gcig pu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du nya'i skye gnas rnam pa sna tshogs kyi nang na gcig pu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, he will be born alone in the various types of fish wombs.

original: de skom gyis gdungs nas srid pa bar ma la chu de mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de skom gyis gdungs nas srid pa bar ma la chu de mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: When he is tormented by thirst, he will see water in the intermediate existence.

original: don du gnyer ba des da ni bdag 'dir skye bar 'gyur snyam nas sems bskyed ma thag tu de nyid du skye bar 'gyur te; srid pa ni rgyu dang / rkyen gyis 'byung la srid pa'i yan lag la gnas pa ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: don du gnyer ba des da ni bdag 'dir skye bar 'gyur snyam nas sems bskyed ma thag tu de nyid du skye bar 'gyur te; srid pa ni rgyu dang / rkyen gyis 'byung la srid pa'i yan lag la gnas pa ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: Thinking, “Now I will be born there,” he will immediately be born there. Existence arises from causes and conditions, and the existence of the beings who are born in the intermediate existence is like this.’

original: gang de sbyin pa ma byin zhing bsod nams ma bsgrubs pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa des chu rtag tu dro bar 'gyur zhing de'i kha yongs su skam par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang de sbyin pa ma byin zhing bsod nams ma bsgrubs pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa des chu rtag tu dro bar 'gyur zhing de'i kha yongs su skam par 'gyur la /
translated: The ripening of such actions, in which one does not give and does not practice virtue, is that the water will always be warm and the water will dry up.

original: reg pa ba tshva dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: reg pa ba tshva dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
translated: The water will be as salty as if it were mixed with salt.

original: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de bya skam sa la rgyu ba dang / bar snang la rgyu ba dag la rtog par byed de /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de bya skam sa la rgyu ba dang / bar snang la rgyu ba dag la rtog par byed de /
translated: “Next, the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will consider the birds that live on dry land and in the sky.

original: las gang gis bya dag bar snang la 'phur zhing nam mkha' rten med pa la rten par byed snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /🔽'di ltar rdzu 'phrul ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: las gang gis bya dag bar snang la 'phur zhing nam mkha' rten med pa la rten par byed snyam nas des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na / 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Wondering what karmic actions may cause birds to fly in the sky and to have a support in the sky, which is without support, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽mos pas bsgyur ba dang / lus @516a *//
analyzed: 'di lta ste / mos pas bsgyur ba dang / lus @516a *//
translated: He will then notice that there are three kinds of miracles:🔽miracles of aspiration,🔽miracles of physical movement,

original: kyis 'gro ba dang / yid ltar mgyogs pa'o //
analyzed: kyis 'gro ba dang / yid ltar mgyogs pa'o //
translated: and miracles of mental speed.

original: de la mos pas bsgyur ba ni rdzu 'phrul can dag gi yin te /
analyzed: de la mos pas bsgyur ba ni rdzu 'phrul can dag gi yin te /
translated: The miracles of aspiration are those of those who have miraculous powers.

original: ji ltar mos ba de ltar 'gro  gal te sa'i khams su rab tu mos pa na de'i tshe nam mkha' sa'i khams su mthong nas 'gro bar byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mos ba de ltar 'gro  gal te sa'i khams su rab tu mos pa na de'i tshe nam mkha' sa'i khams su mthong nas 'gro bar byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: As one wishes, so it goes. If one wishes to go to the earth element, then having seen space as the earth element, one goes there.

original: lus kyis 'gro ba ni chos nyid kyi khyad par  sa gyur pa ste /
analyzed: lus kyis 'gro ba ni chos nyid kyi khyad par  sa gyur pa ste /
translated: Going by body is the transformation of the special nature of the elements,

original: bya rnams lta bu'o //
analyzed: bya rnams lta bu'o //
translated: like birds.

original: yid ltar mgyogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas kyi yin la /
analyzed: yid ltar mgyogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas kyi yin la /
translated: Swift as thought is that of the Tathāgata, the Buddha.

original: yid kyis ji ltar gzas pa de bzhin du gnas gzhan du phyin par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: yid kyis ji ltar gzas pa de bzhin du gnas gzhan du phyin par byed pa yin te /
translated: One goes to another place just as one intends.

original: de yang khams gsum gyi las so so'i bye brag gis de ltar rdzu 'phrul rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ba mthong ngo ////
analyzed: de yang khams gsum gyi las so so'i bye brag gis de ltar rdzu 'phrul rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ba mthong ngo ////
translated: One sees that there are three kinds of supernormal knowledge in the three realms, due to the specific actions of each.
